12.english: Go, and proclaim these words toward the north, and say: return, thou backsliding Israel, saith the LORD; I will not frown upon you; for I am merciful, saith the LORD, I will not bear grudge for ever.

13.english: Only acknowledge thine iniquity, that thou hast transgressed against the LORD thy God, and hast scattered thy ways to the strangers under every leafy tree, and ye have not hearkened to My voice, saith the LORD.

15.english: and I will give you shepherds according to My heart, who shall feed you with knowledge and understanding.

16.english: And it shall come to pass, when ye are multiplied and increased in the land, in those days, saith the LORD, they shall say no more: The ark of the covenant of the LORD; neither shall it come to mind; neither shall they make mention of it; neither shall they miss it; neither shall it be made any more.

17.english: At that time they shall call Jerusalem the throne of the LORD; and all the nations shall be gathered unto it, to the name of the LORD, to Jerusalem; neither shall they walk any more after the stubbornness of their evil heart. {S}

18.hebrew: ††бћ«йћ»оƒйн д»д≈оћ»д, й≈мјлећ б≈йъ-йјдећг»д т«м-бћ≈йъ йƒщ“јш»а≈м; ејй»б…аећ й«зјгћ»е, о≈а∆ш∆х ц»фе…п, т«м-д»а»ш∆х, а¬щ—∆ш дƒрјз«мјъћƒй а∆ъ-а¬бе…ъ≈йл∆н.
18.english: In those days the house of Judah shall walk with the house of Israel, and they shall come together out of the land of the north to the land that I have given for an inheritance unto your fathers.'

19.english: But I said: 'How would I put thee among the sons, and give thee a pleasant land, the goodliest heritage of the nations!' And I said: 'Thou shalt call Me, My father; and shalt not turn away from following Me.'

20.hebrew: ††а»л≈п бћ»вјг»д аƒщћ—»д, о≈ш≈т»дћ; лћ≈п бћјв«гјъћ∆н бћƒй бћ≈йъ йƒщ“јш»а≈м, рјаЋн-йјде»д.
20.english: Surely as a wife treacherously departeth from her husband, so have ye dealt treacherously with Me, O house of Israel, saith the LORD.

21.english: Hark! upon the high hills is heard the suppliant weeping of the children of Israel; for that they have perverted their way, they have forgotten the LORD their God.

22.english: Return, ye backsliding children, I will heal your backslidings.--'Here we are, we are come unto Thee; for Thou art the LORD our God.

23.english: Truly vain have proved the hills, the uproar on the mountains; truly in the LORD our God is the salvation of Israel.

24.english: But the shameful thing hath devoured the labour of our fathers from our youth; their flocks and their herds, their sons and their daughters.

25.english: Let us lie down in our shame, and let our confusion cover us; for we have sinned against the LORD our God, we and our fathers, from our youth even unto this day; and we have not hearkened to the voice of the LORD our God.' {S}

1.hebrew: אִם-תָּשׁוּב יִשְׂרָאֵל נְאֻם-יְהוָה אֵלַי, תָּשׁוּב; וְאִם-תָּסִיר שִׁקּוּצֶיךָ מִפָּנַי, וְלֹא תָנוּד.
1.english: If thou wilt return, O Israel, saith the LORD, yea, return unto Me; and if thou wilt put away thy detestable things out of My sight, and wilt not waver;

2.hebrew: וְנִשְׁבַּעְתָּ, חַי-יְהוָה, בֶּאֱמֶת, בְּמִשְׁפָּט וּבִצְדָקָה; וְהִתְבָּרְכוּ בוֹ גּוֹיִם, וּבוֹ יִתְהַלָּלוּ.  {ס}
2.english: And wilt swear: 'As the LORD liveth' in truth, in justice, and in righteousness; then shall the nations bless themselves by Him, and in Him shall they glory. {S}

3.hebrew: כִּי-כֹה אָמַר יְהוָה, לְאִישׁ יְהוּדָה וְלִירוּשָׁלִַם, נִירוּ לָכֶם, נִיר; וְאַל-תִּזְרְעוּ, אֶל-קֹצִים.
3.english: For thus saith the LORD to the men of Judah and to Jerusalem: break up for you a fallow ground, and sow not among thorns.

4.hebrew: הִמֹּלוּ לַיהוָה, וְהָסִרוּ עָרְלוֹת לְבַבְכֶם, אִישׁ יְהוּדָה, וְיֹשְׁבֵי יְרוּשָׁלִָם:  פֶּן-תֵּצֵא כָאֵשׁ חֲמָתִי, וּבָעֲרָה וְאֵין מְכַבֶּה--מִפְּנֵי, רֹעַ מַעַלְלֵיכֶם.
4.english: Circumcise yourselves to the LORD, and take away the foreskins of your heart, ye men of Judah and inhabitants of Jerusalem; lest My fury go forth like fire, and burn that none can quench it, because of the evil of your doings.

5.hebrew: הַגִּידוּ בִיהוּדָה, וּבִירוּשָׁלִַם הַשְׁמִיעוּ, וְאִמְרוּ, ותקעו (תִּקְעוּ) שׁוֹפָר בָּאָרֶץ; קִרְאוּ מַלְאוּ וְאִמְרוּ, הֵאָסְפוּ וְנָבוֹאָה אֶל-עָרֵי הַמִּבְצָר.
5.english: Declare ye in Judah, and publish in Jerusalem, and say: 'Blow ye the horn in the land'; cry aloud and say: 'Assemble yourselves, and let us go into the fortified cities.'

6.hebrew: שְׂאוּ-נֵס צִיּוֹנָה, הָעִיזוּ אַל-תַּעֲמֹדוּ:  כִּי רָעָה, אָנֹכִי מֵבִיא מִצָּפוֹן--וְשֶׁבֶר גָּדוֹל.
6.english: Set up a standard toward Zion; put yourselves under covert, stay not; for I will bring evil from the north, and a great destruction.

7.hebrew: עָלָה אַרְיֵה, מִסֻּבְּכוֹ, וּמַשְׁחִית גּוֹיִם, נָסַע יָצָא מִמְּקֹמוֹ--לָשׂוּם אַרְצֵךְ לְשַׁמָּה, עָרַיִךְ תִּצֶּינָה מֵאֵין יוֹשֵׁב.
7.english: A lion is gone up from his thicket, and a destroyer of nations is set out, gone forth from his place; to make thy land desolate, that thy cities be laid waste, without inhabitant.

8.hebrew: עַל-זֹאת חִגְרוּ שַׂקִּים, סִפְדוּ וְהֵילִילוּ:  כִּי לֹא-שָׁב חֲרוֹן אַף-יְהוָה, מִמֶּנּוּ.  {פ}
8.english: For this gird you with sackcloth, lament and wail; for the fierce anger of the LORD is not turned back from us. {P}

9.hebrew: וְהָיָה בַיּוֹם-הַהוּא נְאֻם-יְהוָה, יֹאבַד לֵב-הַמֶּלֶךְ וְלֵב הַשָּׂרִים; וְנָשַׁמּוּ, הַכֹּהֲנִים, וְהַנְּבִאִים, יִתְמָהוּ.  {ס}
9.english: And it shall come to pass at that day, saith the LORD, that the heart of the king shall fail, and the heart of the princes; and the priests shall be astonished, and the prophets shall wonder. {S}

10.hebrew: וָאֹמַר אֲהָהּ אֲדֹנָי יְהוִה, אָכֵן הַשֵּׁא הִשֵּׁאתָ לָעָם הַזֶּה וְלִירוּשָׁלִַם לֵאמֹר, שָׁלוֹם, יִהְיֶה לָכֶם; וְנָגְעָה חֶרֶב, עַד-הַנָּפֶשׁ.
10.english: Then said I: 'Ah, Lord GOD! surely Thou hast greatly deceived this people and Jerusalem, saying: Ye shall have peace; whereas the sword reacheth unto the soul.'

11.hebrew: בָּעֵת הַהִיא, יֵאָמֵר לָעָם-הַזֶּה וְלִירוּשָׁלִַם, רוּחַ צַח שְׁפָיִם בַּמִּדְבָּר, דֶּרֶךְ בַּת-עַמִּי--לוֹא לִזְרוֹת, וְלוֹא לְהָבַר.
11.english: At that time shall it be said of this people and of Jerusalem; a hot wind of the high hills in the wilderness toward the daughter of My people, not to fan, nor to cleanse;

12.hebrew: רוּחַ מָלֵא מֵאֵלֶּה, יָבוֹא לִי; עַתָּה, גַּם-אֲנִי אֲדַבֵּר מִשְׁפָּטִים אוֹתָם.
12.english: A wind too strong for this shall come for Me; now will I also utter judgments against them.

13.hebrew: הִנֵּה כַּעֲנָנִים יַעֲלֶה, וְכַסּוּפָה מַרְכְּבוֹתָיו--קַלּוּ מִנְּשָׁרִים, סוּסָיו; אוֹי לָנוּ, כִּי שֻׁדָּדְנוּ.
13.english: Behold, he cometh up as clouds, and his chariots are as the whirlwind; his horses are swifter than eagles.--'Woe unto us! for we are undone.'--

14.hebrew: כַּבְּסִי מֵרָעָה לִבֵּךְ יְרוּשָׁלִַם, לְמַעַן תִּוָּשֵׁעִי:  עַד-מָתַי תָּלִין בְּקִרְבֵּךְ, מַחְשְׁבוֹת אוֹנֵךְ.
14.english: O Jerusalem, wash thy heart from wickedness, that thou mayest be saved. How long shall thy baleful thoughts lodge within thee?

15.hebrew: כִּי קוֹל מַגִּיד, מִדָּן; וּמַשְׁמִיעַ אָוֶן, מֵהַר אֶפְרָיִם.
15.english: For hark! one declareth from Dan, and announceth calamity from the hills of Ephraim:

16.hebrew: הַזְכִּירוּ לַגּוֹיִם, הִנֵּה הַשְׁמִיעוּ עַל-יְרוּשָׁלִַם, נֹצְרִים בָּאִים, מֵאֶרֶץ הַמֶּרְחָק; וַיִּתְּנוּ עַל-עָרֵי יְהוּדָה, קוֹלָם.
16.english: 'Make ye mention to the nations: behold--publish concerning Jerusalem--watchers come from a far country, and give out their voice against the cities of Judah.'

17.hebrew: כְּשֹׁמְרֵי שָׂדַי, הָיוּ עָלֶיהָ מִסָּבִיב:  כִּי-אֹתִי מָרָתָה, נְאֻם-יְהוָה.
17.english: As keepers of a field are they against her round about; because she hath been rebellious against Me, saith the LORD.

18.hebrew: דַּרְכֵּךְ, וּמַעֲלָלַיִךְ, עָשׂוֹ אֵלֶּה, לָךְ; זֹאת רָעָתֵךְ כִּי מָר, כִּי נָגַע עַד-לִבֵּךְ.  {פ}
18.english: Thy way and thy doings have procured these things unto thee; this is thy wickedness; yea, it is bitter, yea, it reacheth unto thy heart. {P}

19.hebrew: מֵעַי מֵעַי אחולה (אֹחִילָה) קִירוֹת לִבִּי, הֹמֶה-לִּי לִבִּי--לֹא אַחֲרִשׁ:  כִּי קוֹל שׁוֹפָר שמעתי (שָׁמַעַתְּ) נַפְשִׁי, תְּרוּעַת מִלְחָמָה.
19.english: My bowels, my bowels! I writhe in pain! The chambers of my heart! My heart moaneth within me! I cannot hold my peace! because thou hast heard, O my soul, the sound of the horn, the alarm of war.

20.hebrew: שֶׁבֶר עַל-שֶׁבֶר נִקְרָא, כִּי שֻׁדְּדָה כָּל-הָאָרֶץ; פִּתְאֹם שֻׁדְּדוּ אֹהָלַי, רֶגַע יְרִיעֹתָי.
20.english: Destruction followeth upon destruction, for the whole land is spoiled; suddenly are my tents spoiled, my curtains in a moment.

21.hebrew: עַד-מָתַי, אֶרְאֶה-נֵּס--אֶשְׁמְעָה, קוֹל שׁוֹפָר.  {פ}
21.english: How long shall I see the standard, shall I hear the sound of the horn? {P}

22.hebrew: כִּי אֱוִיל עַמִּי, אוֹתִי לֹא יָדָעוּ--בָּנִים סְכָלִים הֵמָּה, וְלֹא נְבוֹנִים הֵמָּה; חֲכָמִים הֵמָּה לְהָרַע, וּלְהֵיטִיב לֹא יָדָעוּ.
22.english: For My people is foolish, they know Me not; they are sottish children, and they have no understanding; they are wise to do evil, but to do good they have no knowledge.

23.hebrew: רָאִיתִי, אֶת-הָאָרֶץ, וְהִנֵּה-תֹהוּ, וָבֹהוּ; וְאֶל-הַשָּׁמַיִם, וְאֵין אוֹרָם.
23.english: I beheld the earth, and, lo, it was waste and void; and the heavens, and they had no light.

24.hebrew: רָאִיתִי, הֶהָרִים, וְהִנֵּה, רֹעֲשִׁים; וְכָל-הַגְּבָעוֹת, הִתְקַלְקָלוּ.
24.english: I beheld the mountains, and, lo, they trembled, and all the hills moved to and fro.

25.hebrew: רָאִיתִי, וְהִנֵּה אֵין הָאָדָם; וְכָל-עוֹף הַשָּׁמַיִם, נָדָדוּ.
25.english: I beheld, and, lo, there was no man, and all the birds of the heavens were fled.

26.hebrew: רָאִיתִי, וְהִנֵּה הַכַּרְמֶל הַמִּדְבָּר; וְכָל-עָרָיו, נִתְּצוּ מִפְּנֵי יְהוָה--מִפְּנֵי, חֲרוֹן אַפּוֹ.  {ס}
26.english: I beheld, and, lo, the fruitful field was a wilderness, and all the cities thereof were broken down at the presence of the LORD, and before His fierce anger. {S}

27.hebrew: כִּי-כֹה אָמַר יְהוָה, שְׁמָמָה תִהְיֶה כָּל-הָאָרֶץ; וְכָלָה, לֹא אֶעֱשֶׂה.
27.english: For thus saith the LORD: The whole land shall be desolate; yet will I not make a full end.

28.hebrew: עַל-זֹאת תֶּאֱבַל הָאָרֶץ, וְקָדְרוּ הַשָּׁמַיִם מִמָּעַל--עַל כִּי-דִבַּרְתִּי זַמֹּתִי, וְלֹא נִחַמְתִּי וְלֹא-אָשׁוּב מִמֶּנָּה.
28.english: For this shall the earth mourn, and the heavens above be black; because I have spoken it, I have purposed it, and I have not repented, neither will I turn back from it.

29.hebrew: מִקּוֹל פָּרָשׁ וְרֹמֵה קֶשֶׁת, בֹּרַחַת כָּל-הָעִיר--בָּאוּ בֶּעָבִים, וּבַכֵּפִים עָלוּ:  כָּל-הָעִיר עֲזוּבָה, וְאֵין-יוֹשֵׁב בָּהֵן אִישׁ.
29.english: For the noise of the horsemen and bowmen the whole city fleeth; they go into the thickets, and climb up upon the rocks; every city is forsaken, and not a man dwelleth therein.

30.hebrew: ואתי (וְאַתְּ) שָׁדוּד מַה-תַּעֲשִׂי, כִּי-תִלְבְּשִׁי שָׁנִי כִּי-תַעְדִּי עֲדִי-זָהָב כִּי-תִקְרְעִי בַפּוּךְ עֵינַיִךְ--לַשָּׁוְא, תִּתְיַפִּי:  מָאֲסוּ-בָךְ עֹגְבִים, נַפְשֵׁךְ יְבַקֵּשׁוּ.
30.english: And thou, that art spoiled, what doest thou, that thou clothest thyself with scarlet, that thou deckest thee with ornaments of gold, that thou enlargest thine eyes with paint? In vain dost thou make thyself fair; thy lovers despise thee, they seek thy life.

31.hebrew: כִּי קוֹל כְּחוֹלָה שָׁמַעְתִּי, צָרָה כְּמַבְכִּירָה--קוֹל בַּת-צִיּוֹן תִּתְיַפֵּחַ, תְּפָרֵשׂ כַּפֶּיהָ:  אוֹי-נָא לִי, כִּי-עָיְפָה נַפְשִׁי לְהֹרְגִים.  {פ}
31.english: For I have heard a voice as of a woman in travail, the anguish as of her that bringeth forth her first child, the voice of the daughter of Zion, that gaspeth for breath, that spreadeth her hands: 'Woe is me, now! for my soul fainteth before the murderers.' {P}

20.english: Declare ye this in the house of Jacob, and announce it in Judah, saying:

1.hebrew: הָעִזוּ בְּנֵי בִנְיָמִן, מִקֶּרֶב יְרוּשָׁלִַם, וּבִתְקוֹעַ תִּקְעוּ שׁוֹפָר, וְעַל-בֵּית הַכֶּרֶם שְׂאוּ מַשְׂאֵת:  כִּי רָעָה נִשְׁקְפָה מִצָּפוֹן, וְשֶׁבֶר גָּדוֹל.
1.english: Put yourselves under covert, ye children of Benjamin, away from the midst of Jerusalem, and blow the horn in Tekoa, and set up a signal on Beth-cherem; for evil looketh forth from the north, and a great destruction.

2.hebrew: הַנָּוָה, וְהַמְּעֻנָּגָה, דָּמִיתִי, בַּת-צִיּוֹן.
2.english: The comely and delicate one, the daughter of Zion, will I cut off.

3.hebrew: אֵלֶיהָ יָבֹאוּ רֹעִים, וְעֶדְרֵיהֶם; תָּקְעוּ עָלֶיהָ אֹהָלִים סָבִיב, רָעוּ אִישׁ אֶת-יָדוֹ.
3.english: Shepherds with their flocks come unto her; they pitch their tents against her round about; they feed bare every one what is nigh at hand.

4.hebrew: קַדְּשׁוּ עָלֶיהָ מִלְחָמָה, קוּמוּ וְנַעֲלֶה בַצָּהֳרָיִם; אוֹי לָנוּ כִּי-פָנָה הַיּוֹם, כִּי יִנָּטוּ צִלְלֵי-עָרֶב.
4.english: 'Prepare ye war against her; arise, and let us go up at noon!' 'Woe unto us! for the day declineth, for the shadows of the evening are stretched out!'

5.hebrew: קוּמוּ וְנַעֲלֶה בַלָּיְלָה, וְנַשְׁחִיתָה אַרְמְנוֹתֶיהָ.  {פ}
5.english: 'Arise, and let us go up by night, and let us destroy her palaces.' {P}

6.hebrew: כִּי כֹה אָמַר, יְהוָה צְבָאוֹת, כִּרְתוּ עֵצָה, וְשִׁפְכוּ עַל-יְרוּשָׁלִַם סֹלְלָה; הִיא הָעִיר הָפְקַד, כֻּלָּהּ עֹשֶׁק בְּקִרְבָּהּ.
6.english: For thus hath the LORD of hosts said: hew ye down her trees, and cast up a mound against Jerusalem; this is the city to be punished; everywhere there is oppression in the midst of her.

7.hebrew: כְּהָקִיר בור (בַּיִר) מֵימֶיהָ, כֵּן הֵקֵרָה רָעָתָהּ; חָמָס וָשֹׁד יִשָּׁמַע בָּהּ עַל-פָּנַי, תָּמִיד--חֳלִי וּמַכָּה.
7.english: As a cistern welleth with her waters, so she welleth with her wickedness; violence and spoil is heard in her; before Me continually is sickness and wounds.

8.hebrew: הִוָּסְרִי, יְרוּשָׁלִַם--פֶּן-תֵּקַע נַפְשִׁי, מִמֵּךְ:  פֶּן-אֲשִׂימֵךְ שְׁמָמָה, אֶרֶץ לוֹא נוֹשָׁבָה.  {פ}
8.english: Be thou corrected, O Jerusalem, lest My soul be alienated from thee, lest I make thee desolate, a land not inhabited. {P}

9.hebrew: כֹּה אָמַר יְהוָה צְבָאוֹת, עוֹלֵל יְעוֹלְלוּ כַגֶּפֶן שְׁאֵרִית יִשְׂרָאֵל; הָשֵׁב, יָדְךָ, כְּבוֹצֵר, עַל-סַלְסִלּוֹת.
9.english: Thus saith the LORD of hosts: They shall thoroughly glean as a vine the remnant of Israel; turn again thy hand as a grape-gatherer upon the shoots.

10.hebrew: עַל-מִי אֲדַבְּרָה וְאָעִידָה, וְיִשְׁמָעוּ--הִנֵּה עֲרֵלָה אָזְנָם, וְלֹא יוּכְלוּ לְהַקְשִׁיב; הִנֵּה דְבַר-יְהוָה, הָיָה לָהֶם לְחֶרְפָּה--לֹא יַחְפְּצוּ-בוֹ.
10.english: To whom shall I speak and give warning, that they may hear? Behold, their ear is dull, and they cannot attend; behold, the word of the LORD is become unto them a reproach, they have no delight in it.

11.hebrew: וְאֵת חֲמַת יְהוָה מָלֵאתִי, נִלְאֵיתִי הָכִיל--שְׁפֹךְ עַל-עוֹלָל בַּחוּץ, וְעַל סוֹד בַּחוּרִים יַחְדָּו:  כִּי-גַם-אִישׁ עִם-אִשָּׁה יִלָּכֵדוּ, זָקֵן עִם-מְלֵא יָמִים.
11.english: Therefore I am full of the fury of the LORD, I am weary with holding in: pour it out upon the babes in the street, and upon the assembly of young men together; for even the husband with the wife shall be taken, the aged with him that is full of days.

12.hebrew: וְנָסַבּוּ בָתֵּיהֶם לַאֲחֵרִים, שָׂדוֹת וְנָשִׁים יַחְדָּו:  כִּי-אַטֶּה אֶת-יָדִי עַל-יֹשְׁבֵי הָאָרֶץ, נְאֻם-יְהוָה.
12.english: And their houses shall be turned unto others, their fields and their wives together; for I will stretch out My hand upon the inhabitants of the land, saith the LORD.

13.hebrew: כִּי מִקְּטַנָּם וְעַד-גְּדוֹלָם, כֻּלּוֹ בּוֹצֵעַ בָּצַע; וּמִנָּבִיא, וְעַד-כֹּהֵן--כֻּלּוֹ, עֹשֶׂה שָּׁקֶר.
13.english: For from the least of them even unto the greatest of them every one is greedy for gain; and from the prophet even unto the priest every one dealeth falsely.

14.hebrew: וַיְרַפְּאוּ אֶת-שֶׁבֶר עַמִּי, עַל-נְקַלָּה--לֵאמֹר, שָׁלוֹם שָׁלוֹם; וְאֵין, שָׁלוֹם.
14.english: They have healed also the hurt of My people lightly, saying: 'Peace, peace', when there is no peace.

15.hebrew: הֹבִישׁוּ, כִּי תוֹעֵבָה עָשׂוּ; גַּם-בּוֹשׁ לֹא-יֵבוֹשׁוּ, גַּם-הַכְלִים לֹא יָדָעוּ--לָכֵן יִפְּלוּ בַנֹּפְלִים בְּעֵת-פְּקַדְתִּים יִכָּשְׁלוּ, אָמַר יְהוָה.  {ס}
15.english: They shall be put to shame because they have committed abomination; yea, they are not at all ashamed, neither know they how to blush; therefore they shall fall among them that fall, at the time that I punish them they shall stumble, saith the LORD. {S}

16.hebrew: כֹּה אָמַר יְהוָה עִמְדוּ עַל-דְּרָכִים וּרְאוּ וְשַׁאֲלוּ לִנְתִבוֹת עוֹלָם, אֵי-זֶה דֶרֶךְ הַטּוֹב וּלְכוּ-בָהּ, וּמִצְאוּ מַרְגּוֹעַ, לְנַפְשְׁכֶם; וַיֹּאמְרוּ, לֹא נֵלֵךְ.
16.english: Thus saith the LORD: stand ye in the ways and see, and ask for the old paths, where is the good way, and walk therein, and ye shall find rest for your souls. But they said: 'We will not walk therein.'

17.hebrew: וַהֲקִמֹתִי עֲלֵיכֶם צֹפִים, הַקְשִׁיבוּ לְקוֹל שׁוֹפָר; וַיֹּאמְרוּ, לֹא נַקְשִׁיב.
17.english: And I set watchmen over you: 'Attend to the sound of the horn', but they said: 'We will not attend.'

18.hebrew: לָכֵן, שִׁמְעוּ הַגּוֹיִם; וּדְעִי עֵדָה, אֶת-אֲשֶׁר-בָּם.
18.english: Therefore hear, ye nations, and know, O congregation, what is against them.

19.hebrew: שִׁמְעִי הָאָרֶץ--הִנֵּה אָנֹכִי מֵבִיא רָעָה אֶל-הָעָם הַזֶּה, פְּרִי מַחְשְׁבוֹתָם:  כִּי עַל-דְּבָרַי לֹא הִקְשִׁיבוּ, וְתוֹרָתִי וַיִּמְאֲסוּ-בָהּ.
19.english: Hear, O earth: behold, I will bring evil upon this people, even the fruit of their thoughts, because they have not attended unto My words, and as for My teaching, they have rejected it.

20.hebrew: לָמָּה-זֶּה לִי לְבוֹנָה מִשְּׁבָא תָבוֹא, וְקָנֶה הַטּוֹב מֵאֶרֶץ מֶרְחָק; עֹלוֹתֵיכֶם לֹא לְרָצוֹן, וְזִבְחֵיכֶם לֹא-עָרְבוּ לִי.
20.english: To what purpose is to Me the frankincense that cometh from Sheba, and the sweet cane, from a far country? Your burnt-offerings are not acceptable, nor your sacrifices pleasing unto Me.

21.hebrew: לָכֵן, כֹּה אָמַר יְהוָה, הִנְנִי נֹתֵן אֶל-הָעָם הַזֶּה, מִכְשֹׁלִים; וְכָשְׁלוּ בָם אָבוֹת וּבָנִים יַחְדָּו, שָׁכֵן וְרֵעוֹ--יאבדו (וְאָבָדוּ).  {פ}
21.english: Therefore thus saith the LORD: Behold, I will lay stumblingblocks before this people, and the fathers and the sons together shall stumble against them, the neighbour and his friend, and they shall perish. {P}

22.hebrew: כֹּה אָמַר יְהוָה, הִנֵּה עַם בָּא מֵאֶרֶץ צָפוֹן; וְגוֹי גָּדוֹל, יֵעוֹר מִיַּרְכְּתֵי-אָרֶץ.
22.english: Thus saith the LORD: Behold, a people cometh from the north country, and a great nation shall be roused from the uttermost parts of the earth.

23.hebrew: קֶשֶׁת וְכִידוֹן יַחֲזִיקוּ, אַכְזָרִי הוּא וְלֹא יְרַחֵמוּ, קוֹלָם כַּיָּם יֶהֱמֶה, וְעַל-סוּסִים יִרְכָּבוּ; עָרוּךְ, כְּאִישׁ לַמִּלְחָמָה, עָלַיִךְ, בַּת-צִיּוֹן.
23.english: They lay hold on bow and spear, they are cruel, and have no compassion; their voice is like the roaring sea, and they ride upon horses; set in array, as a man for war, against thee, O daughter of Zion.

24.hebrew: שָׁמַעְנוּ אֶת-שָׁמְעוֹ, רָפוּ יָדֵינוּ; צָרָה, הֶחֱזִקַתְנוּ--חִיל, כַּיּוֹלֵדָה.
24.english: 'We have heard the fame thereof, our hands wax feeble, anguish hath taken hold of us, and pain, as of a woman in travail.'

25.hebrew: אַל-תצאי (תֵּצְאוּ) הַשָּׂדֶה, וּבַדֶּרֶךְ אַל-תלכי (תֵּלֵכוּ):  כִּי חֶרֶב לְאֹיֵב, מָגוֹר מִסָּבִיב.
25.english: Go not forth into the field, nor walk by the way; for there is the sword of the enemy, and terror on every side.

26.hebrew: בַּת-עַמִּי חִגְרִי-שָׂק, וְהִתְפַּלְּשִׁי בָאֵפֶר--אֵבֶל יָחִיד עֲשִׂי לָךְ, מִסְפַּד תַּמְרוּרִים:  כִּי פִתְאֹם, יָבֹא הַשֹּׁדֵד עָלֵינוּ.
26.english: O daughter of my people, gird thee with sackcloth, and wallow thyself in ashes; make thee mourning, as for an only son, most bitter lamentation; for the spoiler shall suddenly come upon us.

27.hebrew: בָּחוֹן נְתַתִּיךָ בְעַמִּי, מִבְצָר; וְתֵדַע, וּבָחַנְתָּ אֶת-דַּרְכָּם.
27.english: I have made thee a tower and a fortress among My people; that thou mayest know and try their way.

28.hebrew: כֻּלָּם סָרֵי סוֹרְרִים, הֹלְכֵי רָכִיל נְחֹשֶׁת וּבַרְזֶל; כֻּלָּם מַשְׁחִיתִים, הֵמָּה.
28.english: They are all grievous revolters, going about with slanders; they are brass and iron; they all of them deal corruptly.

29.hebrew: נָחַר מַפֻּחַ, מאשתם (מֵאֵשׁ תַּם) עֹפָרֶת--לַשָּׁוְא צָרַף צָרוֹף, וְרָעִים לֹא נִתָּקוּ.
29.english: The bellows blow fiercely, the lead is consumed of the fire; in vain doth the founder refine, for the wicked are not separated.

30.hebrew: כֶּסֶף נִמְאָס, קָרְאוּ לָהֶם:  כִּי-מָאַס יְהוָה, בָּהֶם.  {פ}
30.english: Refuse silver shall men call them, because the LORD hath rejected them. {P}

11.english: Is this house, whereupon My name is called, become a den of robbers in your eyes? Behold, I, even I, have seen it, saith the LORD.

27.english: And thou shalt speak all these words unto them, but they will not hearken to thee; thou shalt also call unto them, but they will not answer thee.

28.english: Therefore thou shalt say unto them: This is the nation that hath not hearkened to the voice of the LORD their God, nor received correction; faithfulness is perished, and is cut off from their mouth. {S}

29.english: Cut off thy hair, and cast it away, and take up a lamentation on the high hills; for the LORD hath rejected and forsaken the generation of His wrath.

33.english: And the carcasses of this people shall be food for the fowls of the heaven, and for the beasts of the earth; and none shall frighten them away.

34.english: Then will I cause to cease from the cities of Judah, and from the streets of Jerusalem, the voice of mirth and the voice of gladness, the voice of the bridegroom and the voice of the bride; for the land shall be desolate.

1.hebrew: בָּעֵת הַהִיא נְאֻם-יְהוָה ויציאו (יוֹצִיאוּ) אֶת-עַצְמוֹת מַלְכֵי-יְהוּדָה וְאֶת-עַצְמוֹת-שָׂרָיו וְאֶת-עַצְמוֹת הַכֹּהֲנִים וְאֵת עַצְמוֹת הַנְּבִיאִים, וְאֵת עַצְמוֹת יוֹשְׁבֵי-יְרוּשָׁלִָם--מִקִּבְרֵיהֶם.
1.english: At that time, saith the LORD, they shall bring out the bones of the kings of Judah, and the bones of his princes, and the bones of the priests, and the bones of the prophets, and the bones of the inhabitants of Jerusalem, out of their graves;

2.hebrew: וּשְׁטָחוּם לַשֶּׁמֶשׁ וְלַיָּרֵחַ וּלְכֹל צְבָא הַשָּׁמַיִם, אֲשֶׁר אֲהֵבוּם וַאֲשֶׁר עֲבָדוּם וַאֲשֶׁר הָלְכוּ אַחֲרֵיהֶם, וַאֲשֶׁר דְּרָשׁוּם, וַאֲשֶׁר הִשְׁתַּחֲווּ לָהֶם:  לֹא יֵאָסְפוּ וְלֹא יִקָּבֵרוּ, לְדֹמֶן עַל-פְּנֵי הָאֲדָמָה יִהְיוּ.
2.english: and they shall spread them before the sun, and the moon, and all the host of heaven, whom they have loved, and whom they have served, and after whom they have walked, and whom they have sought, and whom they have worshipped; they shall not be gathered, nor be buried, they shall be for dung upon the face of the earth.

3.hebrew: וְנִבְחַר מָוֶת, מֵחַיִּים, לְכֹל הַשְּׁאֵרִית הַנִּשְׁאָרִים, מִן-הַמִּשְׁפָּחָה הָרָעָה הַזֹּאת--בְּכָל-הַמְּקֹמוֹת הַנִּשְׁאָרִים אֲשֶׁר הִדַּחְתִּים שָׁם, נְאֻם יְהוָה צְבָאוֹת.  {ס}
3.english: And death shall be chosen rather than life by all the residue that remain of this evil family, that remain in all the places whither I have driven them, saith the LORD of hosts. {S}

4.hebrew: וְאָמַרְתָּ אֲלֵיהֶם, כֹּה אָמַר יְהוָה, הֲיִפְּלוּ, וְלֹא יָקוּמוּ; אִם-יָשׁוּב, וְלֹא יָשׁוּב.
4.english: Moreover thou shalt say unto them: Thus saith the LORD: do men fall, and not rise up again? Doth one turn away, and not return?

5.hebrew: מַדּוּעַ שׁוֹבְבָה הָעָם הַזֶּה, יְרוּשָׁלִַם--מְשֻׁבָה נִצַּחַת; הֶחֱזִיקוּ, בַּתַּרְמִת--מֵאֲנוּ, לָשׁוּב.
5.english: Why then is this people of Jerusalem slidden back by a perpetual backsliding? They hold fast deceit, they refuse to return.

6.hebrew: הִקְשַׁבְתִּי וָאֶשְׁמָע, לוֹא-כֵן יְדַבֵּרוּ--אֵין אִישׁ נִחָם עַל-רָעָתוֹ, לֵאמֹר מֶה עָשִׂיתִי; כֻּלֹּה, שָׁב במרצותם (בִּמְרוּצָתָם), כְּסוּס שׁוֹטֵף, בַּמִּלְחָמָה.
6.english: I attended and listened, but they spoke not aright; no man repenteth him of his wickedness, saying: 'What have I done?' Every one turneth away in his course, as a horse that rusheth headlong in the battle.

7.hebrew: גַּם-חֲסִידָה בַשָּׁמַיִם, יָדְעָה מוֹעֲדֶיהָ, וְתֹר וסוס (וְסִיס) וְעָגוּר, שָׁמְרוּ אֶת-עֵת בֹּאָנָה; וְעַמִּי--לֹא יָדְעוּ, אֵת מִשְׁפַּט יְהוָה.
7.english: Yea, the stork in the heaven knoweth her appointed times; and the turtle and the swallow and the crane observe the time of their coming; but My people know not the ordinance of the LORD.

8.hebrew: אֵיכָה תֹאמְרוּ חֲכָמִים אֲנַחְנוּ, וְתוֹרַת יְהוָה אִתָּנוּ; אָכֵן הִנֵּה לַשֶּׁקֶר עָשָׂה, עֵט שֶׁקֶר סֹפְרִים.
8.english: How do ye say: 'We are wise, and the Law of the LORD is with us'? Lo, certainly in vain hath wrought the vain pen of the scribes.

9.hebrew: הֹבִשׁוּ חֲכָמִים, חַתּוּ וַיִּלָּכֵדוּ; הִנֵּה בִדְבַר-יְהוָה מָאָסוּ, וְחָכְמַת מֶה לָהֶם.
9.english: The wise men are ashamed, they are dismayed and taken; lo, they have rejected the word of the LORD; and what wisdom is in them?

10.hebrew: לָכֵן אֶתֵּן אֶת-נְשֵׁיהֶם לַאֲחֵרִים, שְׂדוֹתֵיהֶם לְיוֹרְשִׁים--כִּי מִקָּטֹן וְעַד-גָּדוֹל, כֻּלֹּה בֹּצֵעַ בָּצַע:  מִנָּבִיא, וְעַד-כֹּהֵן--כֻּלֹּה, עֹשֶׂה שָּׁקֶר.
10.english: Therefore will I give their wives unto others, and their fields to them that shall possess them; for from the least even unto the greatest every one is greedy for gain, from the prophet even unto the priest every one dealeth falsely.

11.hebrew: וַיְרַפּוּ אֶת-שֶׁבֶר בַּת-עַמִּי, עַל-נְקַלָּה--לֵאמֹר, שָׁלוֹם שָׁלוֹם; וְאֵין, שָׁלוֹם.
11.english: And they have healed the hurt of the daughter of My people lightly, saying: 'Peace, peace', when there is no peace.

12.hebrew: הֹבִשׁוּ, כִּי תוֹעֵבָה עָשׂוּ; גַּם-בּוֹשׁ לֹא-יֵבֹשׁוּ, וְהִכָּלֵם לֹא יָדָעוּ--לָכֵן יִפְּלוּ בַנֹּפְלִים בְּעֵת פְּקֻדָּתָם יִכָּשְׁלוּ, אָמַר יְהוָה.  {פ}
12.english: They shall be put to shame because they have committed abomination; yea, they are not at all ashamed, neither know they how to blush; therefore shall they fall among them that fall, in the time of their visitation they shall stumble, saith the LORD. {P}

13.hebrew: אָסֹף אֲסִיפֵם, נְאֻם-יְהוָה; אֵין עֲנָבִים בַּגֶּפֶן וְאֵין תְּאֵנִים בַּתְּאֵנָה, וְהֶעָלֶה נָבֵל--וָאֶתֵּן לָהֶם, יַעַבְרוּם.
13.english: I will utterly consume them, saith the LORD; there are no grapes on the vine, nor figs on the fig-tree, and the leaf is faded; and I gave them that which they transgress.

14.hebrew: עַל-מָה, אֲנַחְנוּ יֹשְׁבִים--הֵאָסְפוּ וְנָבוֹא אֶל-עָרֵי הַמִּבְצָר, וְנִדְּמָה-שָּׁם:  כִּי יְהוָה אֱלֹהֵינוּ הֲדִמָּנוּ וַיַּשְׁקֵנוּ מֵי-רֹאשׁ, כִּי חָטָאנוּ לַיהוָה.
14.english: 'Why do we sit still? Assemble yourselves, and let us enter into the fortified cities, and let us be cut off there; for the LORD our God hath cut us off, and given us water of gall to drink, because we have sinned against the LORD.

15.hebrew: קַוֵּה לְשָׁלוֹם, וְאֵין טוֹב; לְעֵת מַרְפֵּה, וְהִנֵּה בְעָתָה.
15.english: We looked for peace, but no good came; and for a time of healing, and behold terror!'

16.hebrew: מִדָּן נִשְׁמַע, נַחְרַת סוּסָיו--מִקּוֹל מִצְהֲלוֹת אַבִּירָיו, רָעֲשָׁה כָּל-הָאָרֶץ; וַיָּבוֹאוּ, וַיֹּאכְלוּ אֶרֶץ וּמְלוֹאָהּ--עִיר, וְיֹשְׁבֵי בָהּ.  {פ}
16.english: The snorting of his horses is heard from Dan; at the sound of the neighing of his strong ones the whole land trembleth; for they are come, and have devoured the land and all that is in it, the city and those that dwell therein. {P}

17.hebrew: כִּי הִנְנִי מְשַׁלֵּחַ בָּכֶם, נְחָשִׁים צִפְעֹנִים, אֲשֶׁר אֵין-לָהֶם, לָחַשׁ; וְנִשְּׁכוּ אֶתְכֶם, נְאֻם-יְהוָה.  {ס}
17.english: For, behold, I will send serpents, basilisks, among you, which will not be charmed; and they shall bite you, saith the LORD. {S}

18.hebrew: מַבְלִיגִיתִי, עֲלֵי יָגוֹן; עָלַי, לִבִּי דַוָּי.
18.english: Though I would take comfort against sorrow, my heart is faint within me.

19.hebrew: הִנֵּה-קוֹל שַׁוְעַת בַּת-עַמִּי, מֵאֶרֶץ מַרְחַקִּים, הַיהוָה אֵין בְּצִיּוֹן, אִם-מַלְכָּהּ אֵין בָּהּ; מַדּוּעַ, הִכְעִסוּנִי בִּפְסִלֵיהֶם--בְּהַבְלֵי נֵכָר.
19.english: Behold the voice of the cry of the daughter of my people from a land far off: 'Is not the LORD in Zion? Is not her King in her?'--'Why have they provoked Me with their graven images, and with strange vanities?'--

20.hebrew: עָבַר קָצִיר, כָּלָה קָיִץ; וַאֲנַחְנוּ, לוֹא נוֹשָׁעְנוּ.
20.english: 'The harvest is past, the summer is ended, and we are not saved.'

21.hebrew: עַל-שֶׁבֶר בַּת-עַמִּי, הָשְׁבָּרְתִּי; קָדַרְתִּי, שַׁמָּה הֶחֱזִקָתְנִי.
21.english: For the hurt of the daughter of my people am I seized with anguish; I am black, appalment hath taken hold on me.

22.hebrew: הַצֳּרִי אֵין בְּגִלְעָד, אִם-רֹפֵא אֵין שָׁם:  כִּי, מַדּוּעַ לֹא עָלְתָה, אֲרֻכַת, בַּת-עַמִּי.  {ס}
22.english: Is there no balm in Gilead? Is there no physician there? Why then is not the health of the daughter of my people recovered? {S}

23.hebrew: מִי-יִתֵּן רֹאשִׁי מַיִם, וְעֵינִי מְקוֹר דִּמְעָה; וְאֶבְכֶּה יוֹמָם וָלַיְלָה, אֵת חַלְלֵי בַת-עַמִּי.  {ס}
23.english: Oh that my head were waters, and mine eyes a fountain of tears, that I might weep day and night for the slain of the daughter of my people! {S}

1.hebrew: מִי-יִתְּנֵנִי בַמִּדְבָּר, מְלוֹן אֹרְחִים, וְאֶעֶזְבָה אֶת-עַמִּי, וְאֵלְכָה מֵאִתָּם:  כִּי כֻלָּם מְנָאֲפִים, עֲצֶרֶת בֹּגְדִים.
1.english: Oh that I were in the wilderness, in a lodging-place of wayfaring men, that I might leave my people, and go from them! For they are all adulterers, an assembly of treacherous men.

2.hebrew: וַיַּדְרְכוּ אֶת-לְשׁוֹנָם קַשְׁתָּם שֶׁקֶר, וְלֹא לֶאֱמוּנָה גָּבְרוּ בָאָרֶץ:  כִּי מֵרָעָה אֶל-רָעָה יָצָאוּ וְאֹתִי לֹא-יָדָעוּ, נְאֻם-יְהוָה.
2.english: And they bend their tongue, their bow of falsehood; and they are grown mighty in the land, but not for truth; for they proceed from evil to evil, and Me they know not, saith the LORD.

3.hebrew: אִישׁ מֵרֵעֵהוּ הִשָּׁמֵרוּ, וְעַל-כָּל-אָח אַל-תִּבְטָחוּ:  כִּי כָל-אָח עָקוֹב יַעְקֹב, וְכָל-רֵעַ רָכִיל יַהֲלֹךְ.
3.english: Take ye heed every one of his neighbour, and trust ye not in any brother; for every brother acteth subtly, and every neighbour goeth about with slanders.

4.hebrew: וְאִישׁ בְּרֵעֵהוּ יְהָתֵלּוּ, וֶאֱמֶת לֹא יְדַבֵּרוּ; לִמְּדוּ לְשׁוֹנָם דַּבֶּר-שֶׁקֶר, הַעֲוֵה נִלְאוּ.
4.english: And they deceive every one his neighbour, and truth they speak not; they have taught their tongue to speak lies, they weary themselves to commit iniquity.

5.hebrew: שִׁבְתְּךָ, בְּתוֹךְ מִרְמָה; בְּמִרְמָה מֵאֲנוּ דַעַת-אוֹתִי, נְאֻם-יְהוָה.  {ס}
5.english: Thy habitation is in the midst of deceit; through deceit they refuse to know Me, saith the LORD. {S}

6.hebrew: לָכֵן, כֹּה אָמַר יְהוָה צְבָאוֹת, הִנְנִי צוֹרְפָם, וּבְחַנְתִּים:  כִּי-אֵיךְ אֶעֱשֶׂה, מִפְּנֵי בַּת-עַמִּי.
6.english: Therefore thus saith the LORD of hosts: behold, I will smelt them, and try them; for how else should I do, because of the daughter of My people?

7.hebrew: חֵץ שוחט (שָׁחוּט) לְשׁוֹנָם, מִרְמָה דִבֵּר; בְּפִיו, שָׁלוֹם אֶת-רֵעֵהוּ יְדַבֵּר, וּבְקִרְבּוֹ, יָשִׂים אָרְבּוֹ.
7.english: Their tongue is a sharpened arrow, it speaketh deceit; one speaketh peaceably to his neighbour with his mouth, but in his heart he layeth wait for him.

8.hebrew: הַעַל-אֵלֶּה לֹא-אֶפְקָד-בָּם, נְאֻם-יְהוָה; אִם בְּגוֹי אֲשֶׁר-כָּזֶה, לֹא תִתְנַקֵּם נַפְשִׁי.  {ס}
8.english: Shall I not punish them for these things? saith the LORD; shall not My soul be avenged on such a nation as this? {S}

9.hebrew: עַל-הֶהָרִים אֶשָּׂא בְכִי וָנֶהִי, וְעַל-נְאוֹת מִדְבָּר קִינָה--כִּי נִצְּתוּ מִבְּלִי-אִישׁ עֹבֵר, וְלֹא שָׁמְעוּ קוֹל מִקְנֶה; מֵעוֹף הַשָּׁמַיִם וְעַד-בְּהֵמָה, נָדְדוּ הָלָכוּ.
9.english: For the mountains will I take up a weeping and wailing, and for the pastures of the wilderness a lamentation, because they are burned up, so that none passeth through. And they hear not the voice of the cattle; both the fowl of the heavens and the beast are fled, and gone.

10.hebrew: וְנָתַתִּי אֶת-יְרוּשָׁלִַם לְגַלִּים, מְעוֹן תַּנִּים; וְאֶת-עָרֵי יְהוּדָה אֶתֵּן שְׁמָמָה, מִבְּלִי יוֹשֵׁב.  {ס}
10.english: And I will make Jerusalem heaps, a lair of jackals; and I will make the cities of Judah a desolation, without an inhabitant. {S}

11.hebrew: מִי-הָאִישׁ הֶחָכָם וְיָבֵן אֶת-זֹאת, וַאֲשֶׁר דִּבֶּר פִּי-יְהוָה אֵלָיו וְיַגִּדָהּ; עַל-מָה אָבְדָה הָאָרֶץ, נִצְּתָה כַמִּדְבָּר מִבְּלִי עֹבֵר.  {ס}
11.english: Who is the wise man, that he may understand this? And who is he to whom the mouth of the LORD hath spoken, that he may declare it? Wherefore is the land perished and laid waste like a wilderness, so that none passeth through? {S}

12.hebrew: וַיֹּאמֶר יְהוָה--עַל-עָזְבָם אֶת-תּוֹרָתִי, אֲשֶׁר נָתַתִּי לִפְנֵיהֶם; וְלֹא-שָׁמְעוּ בְקוֹלִי, וְלֹא-הָלְכוּ בָהּ.
12.english: And the LORD saith: Because they have forsaken My law which I set before them, and have not hearkened to My voice, neither walked therein;

13.hebrew: וַיֵּלְכוּ, אַחֲרֵי שְׁרִרוּת לִבָּם--וְאַחֲרֵי, הַבְּעָלִים, אֲשֶׁר לִמְּדוּם, אֲבוֹתָם.  {פ}
13.english: But have walked after the stubbornness of their own heart, and after the Baalim, which their fathers taught them. {P}

14.hebrew: לָכֵן, כֹּה-אָמַר יְהוָה צְבָאוֹת אֱלֹהֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל, הִנְנִי מַאֲכִילָם אֶת-הָעָם הַזֶּה, לַעֲנָה; וְהִשְׁקִיתִים, מֵי-רֹאשׁ.
14.english: Therefore thus saith the LORD of hosts, the God of Israel: Behold, I will feed them, even this people, with wormwood, and give them water of gall to drink.

15.hebrew: וַהֲפִצוֹתִים, בַּגּוֹיִם, אֲשֶׁר לֹא יָדְעוּ, הֵמָּה וַאֲבוֹתָם; וְשִׁלַּחְתִּי אַחֲרֵיהֶם אֶת-הַחֶרֶב, עַד כַּלּוֹתִי אוֹתָם.  {פ}
15.english: I will scatter them also among the nations, whom neither they nor their fathers have known; and I will send the sword after them, till I have consumed them. {P}

16.hebrew: כֹּה אָמַר יְהוָה צְבָאוֹת, הִתְבּוֹנְנוּ וְקִרְאוּ לַמְקוֹנְנוֹת וּתְבוֹאֶינָה; וְאֶל-הַחֲכָמוֹת שִׁלְחוּ, וְתָבוֹאנָה.
16.english: Thus saith the LORD of hosts: Consider ye, and call for the mourning women, that they may come; and send for the wise women, that they may come;

17.hebrew: וּתְמַהֵרְנָה, וְתִשֶּׂנָה עָלֵינוּ נֶהִי; וְתֵרַדְנָה עֵינֵינוּ דִּמְעָה, וְעַפְעַפֵּינוּ יִזְּלוּ-מָיִם.
17.english: And let them make haste, and take up a wailing for us, that our eyes may run down with tears, and our eyelids gush out with waters.

18.hebrew: כִּי קוֹל נְהִי נִשְׁמַע מִצִּיּוֹן, אֵיךְ שֻׁדָּדְנוּ; בֹּשְׁנוּ מְאֹד כִּי-עָזַבְנוּ אָרֶץ, כִּי הִשְׁלִיכוּ מִשְׁכְּנוֹתֵינוּ.  {ס}
18.english: For a voice of wailing is heard out of Zion: 'How are we undone! We are greatly confounded, because we have forsaken the land, because our dwellings have cast us out.' {S}

19.hebrew: כִּי-שְׁמַעְנָה נָשִׁים דְּבַר-יְהוָה, וְתִקַּח אָזְנְכֶם דְּבַר-פִּיו; וְלַמֵּדְנָה בְנוֹתֵיכֶם נֶהִי, וְאִשָּׁה רְעוּתָהּ קִינָה.
19.english: Yea, hear the word of the LORD, O ye women, and let your ear receive the word of His mouth, and teach your daughters wailing, and every one her neighbour lamentation:

20.hebrew: כִּי-עָלָה מָוֶת בְּחַלּוֹנֵינוּ, בָּא בְּאַרְמְנוֹתֵינוּ--לְהַכְרִית עוֹלָל מִחוּץ, בַּחוּרִים מֵרְחֹבוֹת.
20.english: 'For death is come up into our windows, it is entered into our palaces, to cut off the children from the street, and the young men from the broad places.--

21.hebrew: דַּבֵּר, כֹּה נְאֻם-יְהוָה, וְנָפְלָה נִבְלַת הָאָדָם, כְּדֹמֶן עַל-פְּנֵי הַשָּׂדֶה; וּכְעָמִיר מֵאַחֲרֵי הַקֹּצֵר, וְאֵין מְאַסֵּף.  {ס}
21.english: Speak: Thus saith the LORD--And the carcasses of men fall as dung upon the open field, and as the handful after the harvestman, which none gathereth.' {S}

22.hebrew: כֹּה אָמַר יְהוָה, אַל-יִתְהַלֵּל חָכָם בְּחָכְמָתוֹ, וְאַל-יִתְהַלֵּל הַגִּבּוֹר, בִּגְבוּרָתוֹ; אַל-יִתְהַלֵּל עָשִׁיר, בְּעָשְׁרוֹ.
22.english: Thus saith the LORD: Let not the wise man glory in his wisdom, neither let the mighty man glory in his might, let not the rich man glory in his riches;

23.hebrew: כִּי אִם-בְּזֹאת יִתְהַלֵּל הַמִּתְהַלֵּל, הַשְׂכֵּל וְיָדֹעַ אוֹתִי--כִּי אֲנִי יְהוָה, עֹשֶׂה חֶסֶד מִשְׁפָּט וּצְדָקָה בָּאָרֶץ:  כִּי-בְאֵלֶּה חָפַצְתִּי, נְאֻם-יְהוָה.  {ס}
23.english: But let him that glorieth glory in this, that he understandeth, and knoweth Me, that I am the LORD who exercise mercy, justice, and righteousness, in the earth; for in these things I delight, saith the LORD. {S}

24.hebrew: הִנֵּה יָמִים בָּאִים, נְאֻם-יְהוָה, וּפָקַדְתִּי, עַל-כָּל-מוּל בְּעָרְלָה.
24.english: Behold, the days come, saith the LORD, that I will punish all them that are circumcised in their uncircumcision:

25.hebrew: עַל-מִצְרַיִם וְעַל-יְהוּדָה, וְעַל-אֱדוֹם וְעַל-בְּנֵי עַמּוֹן וְעַל-מוֹאָב, וְעַל כָּל-קְצוּצֵי פֵאָה, הַיֹּשְׁבִים בַּמִּדְבָּר--כִּי כָל-הַגּוֹיִם עֲרֵלִים, וְכָל-בֵּית יִשְׂרָאֵל עַרְלֵי-לֵב.  {פ}
25.english: Egypt, and Judah, and Edom, and the children of Ammon, and Moab, and all that have the corners of their hair polled, that dwell in the wilderness; for all the nations are uncircumcised, but all the house of Israel are uncircumcised in the heart. {P}

1.hebrew: שִׁמְעוּ אֶת-הַדָּבָר, אֲשֶׁר דִּבֶּר יְהוָה עֲלֵיכֶם--בֵּית יִשְׂרָאֵל.
1.english: Hear ye the word which the LORD speaketh unto you, O house of Israel;

2.hebrew: כֹּה אָמַר יְהוָה, אֶל-דֶּרֶךְ הַגּוֹיִם אַל-תִּלְמָדוּ, וּמֵאֹתוֹת הַשָּׁמַיִם, אַל-תֵּחָתּוּ:  כִּי-יֵחַתּוּ הַגּוֹיִם, מֵהֵמָּה.
2.english: thus saith the LORD: Learn not the way of the nations, and be not dismayed at the signs of heaven; for the nations are dismayed at them.

3.hebrew: כִּי-חֻקּוֹת הָעַמִּים, הֶבֶל הוּא:  כִּי-עֵץ מִיַּעַר כְּרָתוֹ, מַעֲשֵׂה יְדֵי-חָרָשׁ בַּמַּעֲצָד.
3.english: For the customs of the peoples are vanity; for it is but a tree which one cutteth out of the forest, the work of the hands of the workman with the axe.

4.hebrew: בְּכֶסֶף וּבְזָהָב, יְיַפֵּהוּ; בְּמַסְמְרוֹת וּבְמַקָּבוֹת יְחַזְּקוּם, וְלוֹא יָפִיק.
4.english: They deck it with silver and with gold, they fasten it with nails and with hammers, that it move not.

5.hebrew: כְּתֹמֶר מִקְשָׁה הֵמָּה וְלֹא יְדַבֵּרוּ, נָשׂוֹא יִנָּשׂוּא כִּי לֹא יִצְעָדוּ; אַל-תִּירְאוּ מֵהֶם כִּי-לֹא יָרֵעוּ, וְגַם-הֵיטֵיב אֵין אוֹתָם.  {פ}
5.english: They are like a pillar in a garden of cucumbers, and speak not; they must needs be borne, because they cannot go. Be not afraid of them, for they cannot do evil, neither is it in them to do good. {P}

6.hebrew: מֵאֵין כָּמוֹךָ, יְהוָה:  גָּדוֹל אַתָּה וְגָדוֹל שִׁמְךָ, בִּגְבוּרָה.
6.english: There is none like unto Thee, O LORD; Thou art great, and Thy name is great in might.

7.hebrew: מִי לֹא יִרָאֲךָ מֶלֶךְ הַגּוֹיִם, כִּי לְךָ יָאָתָה:  כִּי בְכָל-חַכְמֵי הַגּוֹיִם וּבְכָל-מַלְכוּתָם, מֵאֵין כָּמוֹךָ.
7.english: Who would not fear Thee, O king of the nations? For it befitteth Thee; forasmuch as among all the wise men of the nations, and in all their royalty, there is none like unto Thee.

8.hebrew: וּבְאַחַת, יִבְעֲרוּ וְיִכְסָלוּ; מוּסַר הֲבָלִים, עֵץ הוּא.
8.english: But they are altogether brutish and foolish: the vanities by which they are instructed are but a stock;

9.hebrew: כֶּסֶף מְרֻקָּע מִתַּרְשִׁישׁ יוּבָא, וְזָהָב מֵאוּפָז--מַעֲשֵׂה חָרָשׁ, וִידֵי צוֹרֵף; תְּכֵלֶת וְאַרְגָּמָן לְבוּשָׁם, מַעֲשֵׂה חֲכָמִים כֻּלָּם.
9.english: Silver beaten into plates which is brought from Tarshish, and gold from Uphaz, the work of the craftsman and of the hands of the goldsmith; blue and purple is their clothing; they are all the work of skilful men.

10.hebrew: וַיהוָה אֱלֹהִים אֱמֶת, הוּא-אֱלֹהִים חַיִּים וּמֶלֶךְ עוֹלָם; מִקִּצְפּוֹ תִּרְעַשׁ הָאָרֶץ, וְלֹא-יָכִלוּ גוֹיִם זַעְמוֹ.  {פ}
10.english: But the LORD God is the true God, He is the living God, and the everlasting King; at His wrath the earth trembleth, and the nations are not able to abide His indignation. {P}

11.hebrew: כִּדְנָה, תֵּאמְרוּן לְהוֹם, אֱלָהַיָּא, דִּי-שְׁמַיָּא וְאַרְקָא לָא עֲבַדוּ; יֵאבַדוּ מֵאַרְעָא וּמִן-תְּחוֹת שְׁמַיָּא, אֵלֶּה.  {ס}
11.english: Thus shall ye say unto them: 'The gods that have not made the heavens and the earth, these shall perish from the earth, and from under the heavens.' {S}

12.hebrew: עֹשֵׂה אֶרֶץ בְּכֹחוֹ, מֵכִין תֵּבֵל בְּחָכְמָתוֹ; וּבִתְבוּנָתוֹ, נָטָה שָׁמָיִם.
12.english: He that hath made the earth by His power, that hath established the world by His wisdom, and hath stretched out the heavens by His understanding;

13.hebrew: לְקוֹל תִּתּוֹ הֲמוֹן מַיִם, בַּשָּׁמַיִם, וַיַּעֲלֶה נְשִׂאִים, מִקְצֵה ארץ (הָאָרֶץ); בְּרָקִים לַמָּטָר עָשָׂה, וַיּוֹצֵא רוּחַ מֵאֹצְרֹתָיו.
13.english: At the sound of His giving a multitude of waters in the heavens, when He causeth the vapours to ascend from the ends of the earth; when He maketh lightnings with the rain, and bringeth forth the wind out of His treasuries;

14.hebrew: נִבְעַר כָּל-אָדָם מִדַּעַת, הֹבִישׁ כָּל-צוֹרֵף מִפָּסֶל:  כִּי שֶׁקֶר נִסְכּוֹ, וְלֹא-רוּחַ בָּם.
14.english: Every man is proved to be brutish, without knowledge, every goldsmith is put to shame by the graven image, his molten image is falsehood, and there is no breath in them.

15.hebrew: הֶבֶל הֵמָּה, מַעֲשֵׂה תַּעְתֻּעִים; בְּעֵת פְּקֻדָּתָם, יֹאבֵדוּ.
15.english: They are vanity, a work of delusion; in the time of their visitation they shall perish.

16.hebrew: לֹא-כְאֵלֶּה חֵלֶק יַעֲקֹב, כִּי-יוֹצֵר הַכֹּל הוּא, וְיִשְׂרָאֵל, שֵׁבֶט נַחֲלָתוֹ:  יְהוָה צְבָאוֹת, שְׁמוֹ.  {ס}
16.english: Not like these is the portion of Jacob; for He is the former of all things, and Israel is the tribe of His inheritance; the LORD of hosts is His name. {S}

17.hebrew: אִסְפִּי מֵאֶרֶץ, כִּנְעָתֵךְ--ישבתי (יֹשֶׁבֶת), בַּמָּצוֹר.  {ס}
17.english: Gather up thy wares from the ground, O thou that abidest in the siege. {S}

18.hebrew: כִּי-כֹה אָמַר יְהוָה, הִנְנִי קוֹלֵעַ אֶת-יוֹשְׁבֵי הָאָרֶץ בַּפַּעַם הַזֹּאת; וַהֲצֵרֹתִי לָהֶם, לְמַעַן יִמְצָאוּ.  {ס}
18.english: For thus saith the LORD: Behold, I will sling out the inhabitants of the land at this time, and will distress them, that they may feel it. {S}

19.hebrew: אוֹי לִי עַל-שִׁבְרִי, נַחְלָה מַכָּתִי; וַאֲנִי אָמַרְתִּי, אַךְ זֶה חֳלִי וְאֶשָּׂאֶנּוּ.
19.english: Woe is me for my hurt! My wound is grievous; but I said: 'This is but a sickness, and I must bear it.'

20.hebrew: אָהֳלִי שֻׁדָּד, וְכָל-מֵיתָרַי נִתָּקוּ; בָּנַי יְצָאֻנִי, וְאֵינָם--אֵין-נֹטֶה עוֹד אָהֳלִי, וּמֵקִים יְרִיעוֹתָי.
20.english: My tent is spoiled, and all my cords are broken; my children are gone forth of me, and they are not; there is none to stretch forth my tent any more, and to set up my curtains.

21.hebrew: כִּי נִבְעֲרוּ הָרֹעִים, וְאֶת-יְהוָה לֹא דָרָשׁוּ; עַל-כֵּן לֹא הִשְׂכִּילוּ, וְכָל-מַרְעִיתָם נָפוֹצָה.  {פ}
21.english: For the shepherds are become brutish, and have not inquired of the LORD; therefore they have not prospered, and all their flocks are scattered. {P}

22.hebrew: קוֹל שְׁמוּעָה הִנֵּה בָאָה, וְרַעַשׁ גָּדוֹל מֵאֶרֶץ צָפוֹן:  לָשׂוּם אֶת-עָרֵי יְהוּדָה, שְׁמָמָה--מְעוֹן תַּנִּים.  {ס}
22.english: Hark! a report, behold, it cometh, and a great commotion out of the north country, to make the cities of Judah desolate, a dwelling-place of jackals. {S}

23.hebrew: יָדַעְתִּי יְהוָה, כִּי לֹא לָאָדָם דַּרְכּוֹ; לֹא-לְאִישׁ הֹלֵךְ, וְהָכִין אֶת-צַעֲדוֹ.
23.english: O LORD, I know that man's way is not his own; it is not in man to direct his steps as he walketh.

24.hebrew: יַסְּרֵנִי יְהוָה, אַךְ-בְּמִשְׁפָּט:  אַל-בְּאַפְּךָ, פֶּן-תַּמְעִטֵנִי.
24.english: O LORD, correct me, but in measure; not in Thine anger, lest Thou diminish me.

25.hebrew: שְׁפֹךְ חֲמָתְךָ, עַל-הַגּוֹיִם אֲשֶׁר לֹא-יְדָעוּךָ, וְעַל מִשְׁפָּחוֹת, אֲשֶׁר בְּשִׁמְךָ לֹא קָרָאוּ:  כִּי-אָכְלוּ אֶת-יַעֲקֹב, וַאֲכָלֻהוּ וַיְכַלֻּהוּ, וְאֶת-נָוֵהוּ, הֵשַׁמּוּ.  {פ}
25.english: Pour out Thy wrath upon the nations that know Thee not, and upon the families that call not on Thy name; for they have devoured Jacob, yea, they have devoured him and consumed him, and have laid waste his habitation. {P}

16.english: The LORD called thy name a leafy olive-tree, fair with goodly fruit; with the noise of a great tumult He hath kindled fire upon it, and the branches of it are broken.

17.english: For the LORD of hosts, that planted thee, hath pronounced evil against thee, because of the evil of the house of Israel and of the house of Judah, which they have wrought for themselves in provoking Me by offering unto Baal. {P}

19.english: But I was like a docile lamb that is led to the slaughter; and I knew not that they had devised devices against me: 'Let us destroy the tree with the fruit thereof, and let us cut him off from the land of the living, that his name may be no more remembered.'

20.english: But, O LORD of hosts, that judgest righteously, that triest the reins and the heart, let me see Thy vengeance on them; for unto Thee have I revealed my cause. {S}

1.hebrew: צַדִּיק אַתָּה יְהוָה, כִּי אָרִיב אֵלֶיךָ; אַךְ מִשְׁפָּטִים, אֲדַבֵּר אֹתָךְ, מַדּוּעַ דֶּרֶךְ רְשָׁעִים צָלֵחָה, שָׁלוּ כָּל-בֹּגְדֵי בָגֶד.
1.english: Right wouldest Thou be, O LORD, were I to contend with Thee, yet will I reason with Thee: Wherefore doth the way of the wicked prosper? Wherefore are all they secure that deal very treacherously?

2.hebrew: נְטַעְתָּם, גַּם-שֹׁרָשׁוּ--יֵלְכוּ, גַּם-עָשׂוּ פֶרִי; קָרוֹב אַתָּה בְּפִיהֶם, וְרָחוֹק מִכִּלְיוֹתֵיהֶם.
2.english: Thou hast planted them, yea, they have taken root; they grow, yea, they bring forth fruit; Thou art near in their mouth, and far from their reins.

3.hebrew: וְאַתָּה יְהוָה, יְדַעְתָּנִי--תִּרְאֵנִי, וּבָחַנְתָּ לִבִּי אִתָּךְ; הַתִּקֵם כְּצֹאן לְטִבְחָה, וְהַקְדִּשֵׁם לְיוֹם הֲרֵגָה.  {פ}
3.english: But Thou, O LORD, knowest me, Thou seest me, and triest my heart toward Thee; pull them out like sheep for the slaughter, and prepare them for the day of slaughter. {P}

4.hebrew: עַד-מָתַי תֶּאֱבַל הָאָרֶץ, וְעֵשֶׂב כָּל-הַשָּׂדֶה יִיבָשׁ; מֵרָעַת יֹשְׁבֵי-בָהּ, סָפְתָה בְהֵמוֹת וָעוֹף--כִּי אָמְרוּ, לֹא יִרְאֶה אֶת-אַחֲרִיתֵנוּ.
4.english: How long shall the land mourn, and the herbs of the whole field wither? For the wickedness of them that dwell therein, the beasts are consumed, and the birds; because they said: 'He seeth not our end.'

5.hebrew: כִּי אֶת-רַגְלִים רַצְתָּה וַיַּלְאוּךָ, וְאֵיךְ תְּתַחֲרֶה אֶת-הַסּוּסִים; וּבְאֶרֶץ שָׁלוֹם אַתָּה בוֹטֵחַ, וְאֵיךְ תַּעֲשֶׂה בִּגְאוֹן הַיַּרְדֵּן.
5.english: 'If thou hast run with the footmen, and they have wearied thee, then how canst thou contend with horses? And though in a land of peace thou art secure, yet how wilt thou do in the thickets of the Jordan?

6.hebrew: כִּי גַם-אַחֶיךָ וּבֵית-אָבִיךָ, גַּם-הֵמָּה בָּגְדוּ בָךְ--גַּם-הֵמָּה קָרְאוּ אַחֲרֶיךָ, מָלֵא; אַל-תַּאֲמֵן בָּם, כִּי-יְדַבְּרוּ אֵלֶיךָ טוֹבוֹת.  {ס}
6.english: For even thy brethren, and the house of thy father, even they have dealt treacherously with thee, even they have cried aloud after thee; believe them not, though they speak fair words unto thee.' {S}

7.hebrew: עָזַבְתִּי, אֶת-בֵּיתִי--נָטַשְׁתִּי, אֶת-נַחֲלָתִי; נָתַתִּי אֶת-יְדִדוּת נַפְשִׁי, בְּכַף אֹיְבֶיהָ.
7.english: I have forsaken My house, I have cast off My heritage; I have given the dearly beloved of My soul into the hand of her enemies.

8.hebrew: הָיְתָה-לִּי נַחֲלָתִי, כְּאַרְיֵה בַיָּעַר; נָתְנָה עָלַי בְּקוֹלָהּ, עַל-כֵּן שְׂנֵאתִיהָ.
8.english: My heritage is become unto Me as a lion in the forest; she hath uttered her voice against Me; therefore have I hated her.

9.hebrew: הַעַיִט צָבוּעַ נַחֲלָתִי לִי, הַעַיִט סָבִיב עָלֶיהָ; לְכוּ, אִסְפוּ כָּל-חַיַּת הַשָּׂדֶה--הֵתָיוּ לְאָכְלָה.
9.english: Is My heritage unto Me as a speckled bird of prey? Are the birds of prey against her round about? Come ye, assemble all the beasts of the field, bring them to devour.

10.hebrew: רֹעִים רַבִּים שִׁחֲתוּ כַרְמִי, בֹּסְסוּ אֶת-חֶלְקָתִי; נָתְנוּ אֶת-חֶלְקַת חֶמְדָּתִי, לְמִדְבַּר שְׁמָמָה.
10.english: Many shepherds have destroyed My vineyard, they have trodden My portion under foot, they have made My pleasant portion a desolate wilderness.

11.hebrew: שָׂמָהּ, לִשְׁמָמָה--אָבְלָה עָלַי, שְׁמֵמָה; נָשַׁמָּה, כָּל-הָאָרֶץ, כִּי אֵין אִישׁ, שָׂם עַל-לֵב.
11.english: They have made it a desolation, it mourneth unto Me, being desolate; the whole land is made desolate, because no man layeth it to heart.

12.hebrew: עַל-כָּל-שְׁפָיִם בַּמִּדְבָּר, בָּאוּ שֹׁדְדִים, כִּי חֶרֶב לַיהוָה אֹכְלָה, מִקְצֵה-אֶרֶץ וְעַד-קְצֵה הָאָרֶץ:  אֵין שָׁלוֹם, לְכָל-בָּשָׂר.  {ס}
12.english: Upon all the high hills in the wilderness spoilers are come; for the sword of the LORD devoureth from the one end of the land even to the other end of the land, no flesh hath peace. {S}

13.hebrew: זָרְעוּ חִטִּים וְקֹצִים קָצָרוּ, נֶחְלוּ לֹא יוֹעִלוּ; וּבֹשׁוּ, מִתְּבוּאֹתֵיכֶם, מֵחֲרוֹן, אַף-יְהוָה.  {פ}
13.english: They have sown wheat, and have reaped thorns; they have put themselves to pain, they profit not; be ye then ashamed of your increase, because of the fierce anger of the LORD. {P}

14.hebrew: כֹּה אָמַר יְהוָה, עַל-כָּל-שְׁכֵנַי הָרָעִים, הַנֹּגְעִים בַּנַּחֲלָה, אֲשֶׁר-הִנְחַלְתִּי אֶת-עַמִּי אֶת-יִשְׂרָאֵל:  הִנְנִי נֹתְשָׁם מֵעַל אַדְמָתָם, וְאֶת-בֵּית יְהוּדָה אֶתּוֹשׁ מִתּוֹכָם.
14.english: Thus saith the LORD: As for all Mine evil neighbours, that touch the inheritance which I have caused My people Israel to inherit, behold, I will pluck them up from off their land, and will pluck up the house of Judah from among them.

15.hebrew: וְהָיָה, אַחֲרֵי נָתְשִׁי אוֹתָם, אָשׁוּב, וְרִחַמְתִּים; וַהֲשִׁבֹתִים אִישׁ לְנַחֲלָתוֹ, וְאִישׁ לְאַרְצוֹ.
15.english: And it shall come to pass, after that I have plucked them up, I will again have compassion on them; and I will bring them back, every man to his heritage, and every man to his land.

16.hebrew: וְהָיָה אִם-לָמֹד יִלְמְדוּ אֶת-דַּרְכֵי עַמִּי לְהִשָּׁבֵעַ בִּשְׁמִי, חַי-יְהוָה, כַּאֲשֶׁר לִמְּדוּ אֶת-עַמִּי, לְהִשָּׁבֵעַ בַּבָּעַל--וְנִבְנוּ, בְּתוֹךְ עַמִּי.
16.english: And it shall come to pass, if they will diligently learn the ways of My people to swear by My name: 'As the LORD liveth,' even as they taught My people to swear by Baal; then shall they be built up in the midst of My people.

17.hebrew: וְאִם, לֹא יִשְׁמָעוּ:  וְנָתַשְׁתִּי אֶת-הַגּוֹי הַהוּא, נָתוֹשׁ וְאַבֵּד--נְאֻם-יְהוָה.  {ס}
17.english: But if they will not hearken, then will I pluck up that nation, plucking up and destroying it, saith the LORD. {S}

12.english: When they fast, I will not hear their cry; and when they offer burnt-offering and meal-offering, I will not accept them; but I will consume them by the sword, and by the famine, and by the pestilence.' {S}

14.english: Then the LORD said unto me: 'The prophets prophesy lies in My name; I sent them not, neither have I commanded them, neither spoke I unto them; they prophesy unto you a lying vision, and divination, and a thing of nought, and the deceit of their own heart. {S}

16.english: and the people to whom they prophesy shall be cast out in the streets of Jerusalem because of the famine and the sword; and they shall have none to bury them, them, their wives, nor their sons, nor their daughters; for I will pour their evil upon them.'

17.english: And thou shalt say this word unto them: Let mine eyes run down with tears night and day, and let them not cease; for the virgin daughter of my people is broken with a great breach, with a very grievous blow.

18.english: If I go forth into the field, then behold the slain with the sword! And if I enter into the city, then behold them that are sick with famine! For both the prophet and the priest are gone about to a land, and knew it not. {S}

19.english: Hast Thou utterly rejected Judah? Hath Thy soul loathed Zion? Why hast Thou smitten us, and there is no healing for us? We looked for peace, but no good came; and for a time of healing, and behold terror!

20.english: We acknowledge, O LORD, our wickedness, even the iniquity of our fathers; for we have sinned against Thee.

21.english: Do not contemn us, for Thy name's sake, do not dishonour the throne of Thy glory; remember, break not Thy covenant with us.

22.english: Are there any among the vanities of the nations that can cause rain? or can the heavens give showers? Art not Thou He, O LORD our God, and do we not wait for Thee? For Thou hast made all these things. {P}

1.hebrew: וַיֹּאמֶר יְהוָה, אֵלַי, אִם-יַעֲמֹד מֹשֶׁה וּשְׁמוּאֵל לְפָנַי, אֵין נַפְשִׁי אֶל-הָעָם הַזֶּה; שַׁלַּח מֵעַל-פָּנַי, וְיֵצֵאוּ.
1.english: Then said the LORD unto me: 'Though Moses and Samuel stood before Me, yet My mind could not be toward this people; cast them out of My sight, and let them go forth.

2.hebrew: וְהָיָה כִּי-יֹאמְרוּ אֵלֶיךָ, אָנָה נֵצֵא; וְאָמַרְתָּ אֲלֵיהֶם כֹּה-אָמַר יְהוָה, אֲשֶׁר לַמָּוֶת לַמָּוֶת וַאֲשֶׁר לַחֶרֶב לַחֶרֶב, וַאֲשֶׁר לָרָעָב לָרָעָב, וַאֲשֶׁר לַשְּׁבִי לַשֶּׁבִי.
2.english: And it shall come to pass, when they say unto thee: Whither shall we go forth? then thou shall tell them: Thus saith the LORD: Such as are for death, to death; and such as are for the sword, to the sword; and such as are for the famine, to the famine; and such as are for captivity, to captivity.

3.hebrew: וּפָקַדְתִּי עֲלֵיהֶם אַרְבַּע מִשְׁפָּחוֹת, נְאֻם-יְהוָה, אֶת-הַחֶרֶב לַהֲרֹג, וְאֶת-הַכְּלָבִים לִסְחֹב; וְאֶת-עוֹף הַשָּׁמַיִם וְאֶת-בֶּהֱמַת הָאָרֶץ, לֶאֱכֹל וּלְהַשְׁחִית.
3.english: And I will appoint over them four kinds, saith the LORD: the sword to slay, and the dogs to drag, and the fowls of the heaven, and the beasts of the earth, to devour and to destroy.

4.hebrew: וּנְתַתִּים לזועה (לְזַעֲוָה), לְכֹל מַמְלְכוֹת הָאָרֶץ--בִּגְלַל מְנַשֶּׁה בֶן-יְחִזְקִיָּהוּ, מֶלֶךְ יְהוּדָה, עַל אֲשֶׁר-עָשָׂה, בִּירוּשָׁלִָם.
4.english: And I will cause them to be a horror among all the kingdoms of the earth, because of Manasseh the son of Hezekiah king of Judah, for that which he did in Jerusalem.

5.hebrew: כִּי מִי-יַחְמֹל עָלַיִךְ, יְרוּשָׁלִַם, וּמִי, יָנוּד לָךְ; וּמִי יָסוּר, לִשְׁאֹל לְשָׁלֹם לָךְ.
5.english: For who shall have pity upon thee, O Jerusalem? Or who shall bemoan thee? Or who shall turn aside to ask of thy welfare?

6.hebrew: אַתְּ נָטַשְׁתְּ אֹתִי נְאֻם-יְהוָה, אָחוֹר תֵּלֵכִי; וָאַט אֶת-יָדִי עָלַיִךְ וָאַשְׁחִיתֵךְ, נִלְאֵיתִי הִנָּחֵם.
6.english: Thou hast cast Me off, saith the LORD, thou art gone backward; therefore do I stretch out My hand against thee, and destroy thee; I am weary with repenting.

7.hebrew: וָאֶזְרֵם בְּמִזְרֶה, בְּשַׁעֲרֵי הָאָרֶץ; שִׁכַּלְתִּי אִבַּדְתִּי אֶת-עַמִּי, מִדַּרְכֵיהֶם לוֹא-שָׁבוּ.
7.english: And I fan them with a fan in the gates of the land; I bereave them of children, I destroy My people, since they return not from their ways.

8.hebrew: עָצְמוּ-לִי אַלְמְנוֹתָו מֵחוֹל יַמִּים, הֵבֵאתִי לָהֶם עַל-אֵם בָּחוּר שֹׁדֵד בַּצָּהֳרָיִם; הִפַּלְתִּי עָלֶיהָ פִּתְאֹם, עִיר וּבֶהָלוֹת.
8.english: Their widows are increased to Me above the sand of the seas; I bring upon them, against the mother, a chosen one, even a spoiler at noonday; I cause anguish and terrors to fall upon her suddenly.

9.hebrew: אֻמְלְלָה יֹלֶדֶת הַשִּׁבְעָה, נָפְחָה נַפְשָׁהּ באה (בָּא) שִׁמְשָׁהּ בְּעֹד יוֹמָם--בּוֹשָׁה וְחָפֵרָה; וּשְׁאֵרִיתָם, לַחֶרֶב אֶתֵּן לִפְנֵי אֹיְבֵיהֶם--נְאֻם-יְהוָה.  {ס}
9.english: She that hath borne seven languisheth; her spirit droopeth; her sun is gone down while it was yet day, she is ashamed and confounded; and the residue of them will I deliver to the sword before their enemies, saith the LORD.' {S}

10.hebrew: אוֹי-לִי אִמִּי--כִּי יְלִדְתִּנִי אִישׁ רִיב וְאִישׁ מָדוֹן, לְכָל-הָאָרֶץ; לֹא-נָשִׁיתִי וְלֹא-נָשׁוּ-בִי, כֻּלֹּה מְקַלְלַוְנִי.  {ס}
10.english: Woe is me, my mother, that thou hast borne me a man of strife and a man of contention to the whole earth! I have not lent, neither have men lent to me; yet every one of them doth curse me. {S}

11.hebrew: אָמַר יְהוָה, אִם-לֹא שרותך (שֵׁרִיתִיךָ) לְטוֹב; אִם-לוֹא הִפְגַּעְתִּי בְךָ, בְּעֵת רָעָה וּבְעֵת צָרָה--אֶת-הָאֹיֵב.
11.english: The LORD said: 'Verily I will release thee for good; verily I will cause the enemy to make supplication unto thee in the time of evil and in the time of affliction.

12.hebrew: הֲיָרֹעַ בַּרְזֶל בַּרְזֶל מִצָּפוֹן, וּנְחֹשֶׁת.
12.english: Can iron break iron from the north and brass?

13.hebrew: חֵילְךָ וְאוֹצְרוֹתֶיךָ לָבַז אֶתֵּן, לֹא בִמְחִיר; וּבְכָל-חַטֹּאותֶיךָ, וּבְכָל-גְּבוּלֶיךָ.
13.english: Thy substance and thy treasures will I give for a spoil without price, and that for all thy sins, even in all thy borders.

14.hebrew: וְהַעֲבַרְתִּי, אֶת-אֹיְבֶיךָ, בְּאֶרֶץ, לֹא יָדָעְתָּ:  כִּי-אֵשׁ קָדְחָה בְאַפִּי, עֲלֵיכֶם תּוּקָד.  {ס}
14.english: And I will make thee to pass with thine enemies into a land which thou knowest not; for a fire is kindled in My nostril, which shall burn upon you.' {S}

15.hebrew: אַתָּה יָדַעְתָּ יְהוָה, זָכְרֵנִי וּפָקְדֵנִי וְהִנָּקֶם לִי מֵרֹדְפַי--אַל-לְאֶרֶךְ אַפְּךָ, תִּקָּחֵנִי; דַּע, שְׂאֵתִי עָלֶיךָ חֶרְפָּה.
15.english: Thou, O LORD, knowest; remember me, and think of me, and avenge me of my persecutors; take me not away because of Thy long-suffering; know that for Thy sake I have suffered taunts.

16.hebrew: נִמְצְאוּ דְבָרֶיךָ, וָאֹכְלֵם, וַיְהִי דבריך (דְבָרְךָ) לִי, לְשָׂשׂוֹן וּלְשִׂמְחַת לְבָבִי:  כִּי-נִקְרָא שִׁמְךָ עָלַי, יְהוָה אֱלֹהֵי צְבָאוֹת.  {ס}
16.english: Thy words were found, and I did eat them; and Thy words were unto me a joy and the rejoicing of my heart; because Thy name was called on me, O LORD God of hosts. {S}

17.hebrew: לֹא-יָשַׁבְתִּי בְסוֹד-מְשַׂחֲקִים, וָאֶעְלֹז:  מִפְּנֵי יָדְךָ בָּדָד יָשַׁבְתִּי, כִּי-זַעַם מִלֵּאתָנִי.
17.english: I sat not in the assembly of them that make merry, nor rejoiced; I sat alone because of Thy hand; for Thou hast filled me with indignation.

18.hebrew: לָמָּה הָיָה כְאֵבִי נֶצַח, וּמַכָּתִי אֲנוּשָׁה; מֵאֲנָה, הֵרָפֵא--הָיוֹ תִהְיֶה לִי כְּמוֹ אַכְזָב, מַיִם לֹא נֶאֱמָנוּ.  {ס}
18.english: Why is my pain perpetual, and my wound incurable, so that it refuseth to be healed? Wilt Thou indeed be unto me as a deceitful brook, as waters that fail? {S}

19.hebrew: לָכֵן כֹּה-אָמַר יְהוָה, אִם-תָּשׁוּב וַאֲשִׁיבְךָ לְפָנַי תַּעֲמֹד, וְאִם-תּוֹצִיא יָקָר מִזּוֹלֵל, כְּפִי תִהְיֶה; יָשֻׁבוּ הֵמָּה אֵלֶיךָ, וְאַתָּה לֹא-תָשׁוּב אֲלֵיהֶם.
19.english: Therefore thus saith the LORD: if thou return, and I bring thee back, thou shalt stand before Me; and if thou bring forth the precious out of the vile, thou shalt be as My mouth; let them return unto thee, but thou shalt not return unto them.

20.hebrew: וּנְתַתִּיךָ לָעָם הַזֶּה, לְחוֹמַת נְחֹשֶׁת בְּצוּרָה, וְנִלְחֲמוּ אֵלֶיךָ, וְלֹא-יוּכְלוּ לָךְ:  כִּי-אִתְּךָ אֲנִי לְהוֹשִׁיעֲךָ וּלְהַצִּילֶךָ, נְאֻם-יְהוָה.
20.english: And I will make thee unto this people a fortified brazen wall; and they shall fight against thee, but they shall not prevail against thee; for I am with thee to save thee and to deliver thee, saith the LORD.

21.hebrew: וְהִצַּלְתִּיךָ, מִיַּד רָעִים; וּפְדִתִיךָ, מִכַּף עָרִצִים.  {ס}
21.english: And I will deliver thee out of the hand of the wicked, and I will redeem thee out of the hand of the terrible. {S}

19.english: O LORD, my strength, and my stronghold, and my refuge, in the day of affliction, unto Thee shall the nations come from the ends of the earth, and shall say: 'Our fathers have inherited nought but lies, vanity and things wherein there is no profit.'

21.english: Therefore, behold, I will cause them to know, this once will I cause them to know My hand and My might; and they shall know that My name is the LORD. {S}

1.hebrew: חַטַּאת יְהוּדָה, כְּתוּבָה בְּעֵט בַּרְזֶל--בְּצִפֹּרֶן שָׁמִיר:  חֲרוּשָׁה עַל-לוּחַ לִבָּם, וּלְקַרְנוֹת מִזְבְּחוֹתֵיכֶם.
1.english: The sin of Judah is written with a pen of iron, and with the point of a diamond; it is graven upon the tablet of their heart, and upon the horns of your altars.

2.hebrew: כִּזְכֹּר בְּנֵיהֶם מִזְבְּחוֹתָם, וַאֲשֵׁרֵיהֶם עַל-עֵץ רַעֲנָן, עַל, גְּבָעוֹת הַגְּבֹהוֹת.
2.english: Like the symbols of their sons are their altars, and their Asherim are by the leafy trees, upon the high hills.

3.hebrew: הֲרָרִי, בַּשָּׂדֶה--חֵילְךָ כָל-אוֹצְרוֹתֶיךָ, לָבַז אֶתֵּן; בָּמֹתֶיךָ, בְּחַטָּאת בְּכָל-גְּבוּלֶיךָ.
3.english: O thou that sittest upon the mountain in the field, I will give thy substance and all thy treasures for a spoil, and thy high places, because of sin, throughout all thy borders.

4.hebrew: וְשָׁמַטְתָּה, וּבְךָ מִנַּחֲלָתְךָ אֲשֶׁר נָתַתִּי לָךְ, וְהַעֲבַדְתִּיךָ אֶת-אֹיְבֶיךָ, בָּאָרֶץ אֲשֶׁר לֹא-יָדָעְתָּ:  כִּי-אֵשׁ קְדַחְתֶּם בְּאַפִּי, עַד-עוֹלָם תּוּקָד.  {ס}
4.english: And thou, even of thyself, shalt discontinue from thy heritage that I gave thee; and I will cause thee to serve thine enemies in the land which thou knowest not; for ye have kindled a fire in My nostril, which shall burn for ever. {S}

5.hebrew: כֹּה אָמַר יְהוָה, אָרוּר הַגֶּבֶר אֲשֶׁר יִבְטַח בָּאָדָם, וְשָׂם בָּשָׂר, זְרֹעוֹ; וּמִן-יְהוָה, יָסוּר לִבּוֹ.
5.english: Thus saith the LORD: Cursed is the man that trusteth in man, and maketh flesh his arm, and whose heart departeth from the LORD.

6.hebrew: וְהָיָה כְּעַרְעָר בָּעֲרָבָה, וְלֹא יִרְאֶה כִּי-יָבוֹא טוֹב; וְשָׁכַן חֲרֵרִים בַּמִּדְבָּר, אֶרֶץ מְלֵחָה וְלֹא תֵשֵׁב.  {ס}
6.english: For he shall be like a tamarisk in the desert, and shall not see when good cometh; but shall inhabit the parched places in the wilderness, a salt land and not inhabited. {S}

7.hebrew: בָּרוּךְ הַגֶּבֶר, אֲשֶׁר יִבְטַח בַּיהוָה; וְהָיָה יְהוָה, מִבְטַחוֹ.
7.english: Blessed is the man that trusteth in the LORD, and whose trust the LORD is.

8.hebrew: וְהָיָה כְּעֵץ שָׁתוּל עַל-מַיִם, וְעַל-יוּבַל יְשַׁלַּח שָׁרָשָׁיו, וְלֹא ירא (יִרְאֶה) כִּי-יָבֹא חֹם, וְהָיָה עָלֵהוּ רַעֲנָן; וּבִשְׁנַת בַּצֹּרֶת לֹא יִדְאָג, וְלֹא יָמִישׁ מֵעֲשׂוֹת פֶּרִי.
8.english: For he shall be as a tree planted by the waters, and that spreadeth out its roots by the river, and shall not see when heat cometh, but its foliage shall be luxuriant; and shall not be anxious in the year of drought, neither shall cease from yielding fruit.

9.hebrew: עָקֹב הַלֵּב מִכֹּל, וְאָנֻשׁ הוּא; מִי, יֵדָעֶנּוּ.
9.english: The heart is deceitful above all things, and it is exceeding weak--who can know it?

10.hebrew: אֲנִי יְהוָה חֹקֵר לֵב, בֹּחֵן כְּלָיוֹת:  וְלָתֵת לְאִישׁ כִּדְרָכָו, כִּפְרִי מַעֲלָלָיו.  {ס}
10.english: I the LORD search the heart, I try the reins, even to give every man according to his ways, according to the fruit of his doings. {S}

11.hebrew: קֹרֵא דָגַר וְלֹא יָלָד, עֹשֶׂה עֹשֶׁר וְלֹא בְמִשְׁפָּט; בַּחֲצִי יָמָו יַעַזְבֶנּוּ, וּבְאַחֲרִיתוֹ יִהְיֶה נָבָל.
11.english: As the partridge that broodeth over young which she hath not brought forth, so is he that getteth riches, and not by right; in the midst of his days he shall leave them, and at his end he shall be a fool.

12.hebrew: כִּסֵּא כָבוֹד, מָרוֹם מֵרִאשׁוֹן--מְקוֹם, מִקְדָּשֵׁנוּ.
12.english: Thou throne of glory, on high from the beginning, thou place of our sanctuary,

13.hebrew: מִקְוֵה יִשְׂרָאֵל יְהוָה, כָּל-עֹזְבֶיךָ יֵבֹשׁוּ; יסורי (וְסוּרַי) בָּאָרֶץ יִכָּתֵבוּ, כִּי עָזְבוּ מְקוֹר מַיִם-חַיִּים אֶת-יְהוָה.  {פ}
13.english: Thou hope of Israel, the LORD! All that forsake Thee shall be ashamed; they that depart from Thee shall be written in the earth, because they have forsaken the LORD, the fountain of living waters. {P}

14.hebrew: רְפָאֵנִי יְהוָה וְאֵרָפֵא, הוֹשִׁיעֵנִי וְאִוָּשֵׁעָה:  כִּי תְהִלָּתִי, אָתָּה.
14.english: Heal me, O LORD, and I shall be healed; save me, and I shall be saved; for Thou art my praise.

15.hebrew: הִנֵּה-הֵמָּה, אֹמְרִים אֵלָי:  אַיֵּה דְבַר-יְהוָה, יָבוֹא נָא.
15.english: Behold, they say unto me: 'Where is the word of the LORD? let it come now.'

16.hebrew: וַאֲנִי לֹא-אַצְתִּי מֵרֹעֶה אַחֲרֶיךָ, וְיוֹם אָנוּשׁ לֹא הִתְאַוֵּיתִי--אַתָּה יָדָעְתָּ; מוֹצָא שְׂפָתַי, נֹכַח פָּנֶיךָ הָיָה.
16.english: As for me, I have not hastened from being a shepherd after Thee; neither have I desired the woeful day; Thou knowest it; that which came out of my lips was manifest before Thee.

17.hebrew: אַל-תִּהְיֵה-לִי, לִמְחִתָּה; מַחֲסִי-אַתָּה, בְּיוֹם רָעָה.
17.english: Be not a ruin unto me; thou art my refuge in the day of evil.

18.hebrew: יֵבֹשׁוּ רֹדְפַי, וְאַל-אֵבֹשָׁה אָנִי--יֵחַתּוּ הֵמָּה, וְאַל-אֵחַתָּה אָנִי; הָבִיא עֲלֵיהֶם יוֹם רָעָה, וּמִשְׁנֶה שִׁבָּרוֹן שָׁבְרֵם.  {ס}
18.english: Let them be ashamed that persecute me, but let not me be ashamed; let them be dismayed, but let not me be dismayed; bring upon them the day of evil, and destroy them with double destruction. {S}

19.hebrew: כֹּה-אָמַר יְהוָה אֵלַי, הָלֹךְ וְעָמַדְתָּ בְּשַׁעַר בְּנֵי-עם (הָעָם), אֲשֶׁר יָבֹאוּ בוֹ מַלְכֵי יְהוּדָה, וַאֲשֶׁר יֵצְאוּ בוֹ; וּבְכֹל, שַׁעֲרֵי יְרוּשָׁלִָם.
19.english: Thus said the LORD unto me: Go, and stand in the gate of the children of the people, whereby the kings of Judah come in, and by which they go out, and in all the gates of Jerusalem;

20.hebrew: וְאָמַרְתָּ אֲלֵיהֶם שִׁמְעוּ דְבַר-יְהוָה מַלְכֵי יְהוּדָה, וְכָל-יְהוּדָה, וְכֹל, יֹשְׁבֵי יְרוּשָׁלִָם--הַבָּאִים, בַּשְּׁעָרִים הָאֵלֶּה.
20.english: and say unto them: Hear ye the word of the LORD, ye kings of Judah, and all Judah, and all the inhabitants of Jerusalem, that enter in by these gates;

21.hebrew: כֹּה אָמַר יְהוָה, הִשָּׁמְרוּ בְּנַפְשׁוֹתֵיכֶם; וְאַל-תִּשְׂאוּ מַשָּׂא בְּיוֹם הַשַּׁבָּת, וַהֲבֵאתֶם בְּשַׁעֲרֵי יְרוּשָׁלִָם.
21.english: thus saith the LORD: Take heed for the sake of your souls, and bear no burden on the sabbath day, nor bring it in by the gates of Jerusalem;

22.hebrew: וְלֹא-תוֹצִיאוּ מַשָּׂא מִבָּתֵּיכֶם בְּיוֹם הַשַּׁבָּת, וְכָל-מְלָאכָה לֹא תַעֲשׂוּ; וְקִדַּשְׁתֶּם אֶת-יוֹם הַשַּׁבָּת, כַּאֲשֶׁר צִוִּיתִי אֶת-אֲבוֹתֵיכֶם.
22.english: neither carry forth a burden out of your houses on the sabbath day, neither do ye any work; but hallow ye the sabbath day, as I commanded your fathers;

23.hebrew: וְלֹא שָׁמְעוּ, וְלֹא הִטּוּ אֶת-אָזְנָם; וַיַּקְשׁוּ, אֶת-עָרְפָּם, לְבִלְתִּי שומע (שְׁמוֹעַ), וּלְבִלְתִּי קַחַת מוּסָר.
23.english: but they hearkened not, neither inclined their ear, but made their neck stiff, that they might not hear, nor receive instruction.

24.hebrew: וְהָיָה אִם-שָׁמֹעַ תִּשְׁמְעוּן אֵלַי, נְאֻם-יְהוָה, לְבִלְתִּי הָבִיא מַשָּׂא בְּשַׁעֲרֵי הָעִיר הַזֹּאת, בְּיוֹם הַשַּׁבָּת; וּלְקַדֵּשׁ אֶת-יוֹם הַשַּׁבָּת, לְבִלְתִּי עֲשׂוֹת-בֹּה כָּל-מְלָאכָה.
24.english: And it shall come to pass, if ye diligently hearken unto Me, saith the LORD, to bring in no burden through the gates of this city on the sabbath day, but to hallow the sabbath day, to do no work therein;

25.hebrew: וּבָאוּ בְשַׁעֲרֵי הָעִיר הַזֹּאת מְלָכִים וְשָׂרִים יֹשְׁבִים עַל-כִּסֵּא דָוִד רֹכְבִים בָּרֶכֶב וּבַסּוּסִים, הֵמָּה וְשָׂרֵיהֶם--אִישׁ יְהוּדָה, וְיֹשְׁבֵי יְרוּשָׁלִָם; וְיָשְׁבָה הָעִיר-הַזֹּאת, לְעוֹלָם.
25.english: then shall there enter in by the gates of this city kings and princes sitting upon the throne of David, riding in chariots and on horses, they, and their princes, the men of Judah, and the inhabitants of Jerusalem; and this city shall be inhabited for ever.

26.hebrew: וּבָאוּ מֵעָרֵי-יְהוּדָה וּמִסְּבִיבוֹת יְרוּשָׁלִַם וּמֵאֶרֶץ בִּנְיָמִן, וּמִן-הַשְּׁפֵלָה וּמִן-הָהָר וּמִן-הַנֶּגֶב, מְבִאִים עוֹלָה וְזֶבַח, וּמִנְחָה וּלְבוֹנָה--וּמְבִאֵי תוֹדָה, בֵּית יְהוָה.
26.english: And they shall come from the cities of Judah, and from the places round about Jerusalem, and from the land of Benjamin, and from the Lowland, and from the mountains, and from the South, bringing burnt-offerings, and sacrifices, and meal-offerings, and frankincense, and bringing sacrifices of thanksgiving, unto the house of the LORD.

27.hebrew: וְאִם-לֹא תִשְׁמְעוּ אֵלַי, לְקַדֵּשׁ אֶת-יוֹם הַשַּׁבָּת, וּלְבִלְתִּי שְׂאֵת מַשָּׂא וּבֹא בְּשַׁעֲרֵי יְרוּשָׁלִַם, בְּיוֹם הַשַּׁבָּת:  וְהִצַּתִּי אֵשׁ בִּשְׁעָרֶיהָ, וְאָכְלָה אַרְמְנוֹת יְרוּשָׁלִַם--וְלֹא תִכְבֶּה.  {פ}
27.english: But if ye will not hearken unto Me to hallow the sabbath day, and not to bear a burden and enter in at the gates of Jerusalem on the sabbath day; then will I kindle a fire in the gates thereof, and it shall devour the palaces of Jerusalem, and it shall not be quenched. {P}

17.english: I will scatter them as with an east wind before the enemy; I will look upon their back, and not their face, in the day of their calamity. {S}

18.english: Then said they: 'Come, and let us devise devices against Jeremiah; for instruction shall not perish from the priest, nor counsel from the wise, nor the word from the prophet. Come, and let us smite him with the tongue, and let us not give heed to any of his words.'

21.english: Therefore deliver up their children to the famine, and hurl them to the power of the sword; and let their wives be bereaved of their children, and widows; and let their men be slain of death, and their young men smitten of the sword in battle.

22.english: Let a cry be heard from their houses, when thou shalt bring a troop suddenly upon them; for they have digged a pit to take me, and hid snares for my feet.
