30.english: thus saith the LORD: Behold, I will give Pharaoh Hophra king of Egypt into the hand of his enemies, and into the hand of them that seek his life; as I gave Zedekiah king of Judah into the hand of Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon, his enemy, and that sought his life.' {S}

1.hebrew: הַדָּבָר, אֲשֶׁר דִּבֶּר יִרְמְיָהוּ הַנָּבִיא, אֶל-בָּרוּךְ, בֶּן-נֵרִיָּה--בְּכָתְבוֹ אֶת-הַדְּבָרִים הָאֵלֶּה עַל-סֵפֶר, מִפִּי יִרְמְיָהוּ, בַּשָּׁנָה הָרְבִעִית, לִיהוֹיָקִים בֶּן-יֹאשִׁיָּהוּ מֶלֶךְ יְהוּדָה לֵאמֹר.
1.english: The word that Jeremiah the prophet spoke unto Baruch the son of Neriah, when he wrote these words in a book at the mouth of Jeremiah, in the fourth year of Jehoiakim the son of Josiah, king of Judah, saying:

2.hebrew: כֹּה-אָמַר יְהוָה, אֱלֹהֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל, עָלֶיךָ, בָּרוּךְ.
2.english: 'Thus saith the LORD, the God of Israel, concerning thee, O Baruch: Thou didst say:

3.hebrew: אָמַרְתָּ אוֹי-נָא לִי, כִּי-יָסַף יְהוָה יָגוֹן עַל-מַכְאֹבִי; יָגַעְתִּי, בְּאַנְחָתִי, וּמְנוּחָה, לֹא מָצָאתִי.
3.english: Woe is me now! for the LORD hath added sorrow to my pain; I am weary with my groaning, and I find no rest.

4.hebrew: כֹּה תֹּאמַר אֵלָיו, כֹּה אָמַר יְהוָה, הִנֵּה אֲשֶׁר-בָּנִיתִי אֲנִי הֹרֵס, וְאֵת אֲשֶׁר-נָטַעְתִּי אֲנִי נֹתֵשׁ; וְאֶת-כָּל-הָאָרֶץ, הִיא.
4.english: Thus shalt thou say unto him: Thus saith the LORD: Behold, that which I have built will I break down, and that which I have planted I will pluck up; and this in the whole land.

5.hebrew: וְאַתָּה תְּבַקֶּשׁ-לְךָ גְדֹלוֹת, אַל-תְּבַקֵּשׁ:  כִּי הִנְנִי מֵבִיא רָעָה עַל-כָּל-בָּשָׂר, נְאֻם-יְהוָה, וְנָתַתִּי לְךָ אֶת-נַפְשְׁךָ לְשָׁלָל, עַל כָּל-הַמְּקֹמוֹת אֲשֶׁר תֵּלֶךְ-שָׁם.  {פ}
5.english: And seekest thou great things for thyself? seek them not; for, behold, I will bring evil upon all flesh, saith the LORD; but thy life will I give unto thee for a prey in all places whither thou goest.' {P}

1.hebrew: אֲשֶׁר הָיָה דְבַר-יְהוָה אֶל-יִרְמְיָהוּ הַנָּבִיא, עַל-הַגּוֹיִם.
1.english: The word of the LORD which came to Jeremiah the prophet concerning the nations.

2.hebrew: לְמִצְרַיִם, עַל-חֵיל פַּרְעֹה נְכוֹ מֶלֶךְ מִצְרַיִם, אֲשֶׁר-הָיָה עַל-נְהַר-פְּרָת, בְּכַרְכְּמִשׁ--אֲשֶׁר הִכָּה, נְבוּכַדְרֶאצַּר מֶלֶךְ בָּבֶל, בִּשְׁנַת הָרְבִיעִית, לִיהוֹיָקִים בֶּן-יֹאשִׁיָּהוּ מֶלֶךְ יְהוּדָה.
2.english: Of Egypt: concerning the army of Pharaoh-neco king of Egypt, which was by the river Euphrates in Carchemish, which Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon smote in the fourth year of Jehoiakim the son of Josiah, king of Judah.

3.hebrew: עִרְכוּ מָגֵן וְצִנָּה, וּגְשׁוּ לַמִּלְחָמָה.
3.english: Make ready buckler and shield, and draw near to battle.

4.hebrew: אִסְרוּ הַסּוּסִים, וַעֲלוּ הַפָּרָשִׁים, וְהִתְיַצְּבוּ, בְּכוֹבָעִים; מִרְקוּ, הָרְמָחִים, לִבְשׁוּ, הַסִּרְיֹנֹת.
4.english: Harness the horses, and mount, ye horsemen, and stand forth with your helmets; furbish the spears, put on the coats of mail.

5.hebrew: מַדּוּעַ רָאִיתִי, הֵמָּה חַתִּים נְסֹגִים אָחוֹר, וְגִבּוֹרֵיהֶם יֻכַּתּוּ, וּמָנוֹס נָסוּ וְלֹא הִפְנוּ--מָגוֹר מִסָּבִיב, נְאֻם-יְהוָה.
5.english: Wherefore do I see them dismayed and turned backward? and their mighty ones are beaten down, and they are fled apace, and look not back; terror is on every side, saith the LORD.

6.hebrew: אַל-יָנוּס הַקַּל, וְאַל-יִמָּלֵט הַגִּבּוֹר; צָפוֹנָה עַל-יַד נְהַר-פְּרָת, כָּשְׁלוּ וְנָפָלוּ.
6.english: The swift cannot flee away, nor the mighty man escape; in the north by the river Euphrates have they stumbled and fallen.

7.hebrew: מִי-זֶה, כַּיְאֹר יַעֲלֶה; כַּנְּהָרוֹת, יִתְגָּעֲשׁוּ מֵימָיו.
7.english: Who is this like the Nile that riseth up, like the rivers whose waters toss themselves?

8.hebrew: מִצְרַיִם כַּיְאֹר יַעֲלֶה, וְכַנְּהָרוֹת יִתְגֹּעֲשׁוּ מָיִם; וַיֹּאמֶר, אַעֲלֶה אֲכַסֶּה-אֶרֶץ, אֹבִידָה עִיר, וְיֹשְׁבֵי בָהּ.
8.english: Egypt is like the Nile that riseth up, and like the rivers whose waters toss themselves; and he saith: 'I will rise up, I will cover the earth, I will destroy the city and the inhabitants thereof.'

9.hebrew: עֲלוּ הַסּוּסִים וְהִתְהֹלְלוּ הָרֶכֶב, וְיֵצְאוּ הַגִּבּוֹרִים--כּוּשׁ וּפוּט, תֹּפְשֵׂי מָגֵן, וְלוּדִים, תֹּפְשֵׂי דֹּרְכֵי קָשֶׁת.
9.english: Prance, ye horses, and rush madly, ye chariots; and let the mighty men go forth: Cush and Put, that handle the shield, and the Ludim, that handle and bend the bow.

10.hebrew: וְהַיּוֹם הַהוּא לַאדֹנָי יְהוִה צְבָאוֹת, יוֹם נְקָמָה לְהִנָּקֵם מִצָּרָיו, וְאָכְלָה חֶרֶב וְשָׂבְעָה, וְרָוְתָה מִדָּמָם:  כִּי זֶבַח לַאדֹנָי יְהוִה צְבָאוֹת, בְּאֶרֶץ צָפוֹן--אֶל-נְהַר-פְּרָת.
10.english: For the Lord GOD of hosts shall have on that day a day of vengeance, that He may avenge Him of His adversaries; and the sword shall devour and be satiate, and shall be made drunk with their blood; for the Lord GOD of hosts hath a sacrifice in the north country by the river Euphrates.

11.hebrew: עֲלִי גִלְעָד וּקְחִי צֳרִי, בְּתוּלַת בַּת-מִצְרָיִם; לַשָּׁוְא הרביתי (הִרְבֵּית) רְפֻאוֹת, תְּעָלָה אֵין לָךְ.
11.english: Go up into Gilead, and take balm, O virgin daughter of Egypt; in vain dost thou use many medicines; there is no cure for thee.

12.hebrew: שָׁמְעוּ גוֹיִם קְלוֹנֵךְ, וְצִוְחָתֵךְ מָלְאָה הָאָרֶץ:  כִּי-גִבּוֹר בְּגִבּוֹר כָּשָׁלוּ, יַחְדָּיו נָפְלוּ שְׁנֵיהֶם.  {פ}
12.english: The nations have heard of thy shame, and the earth is full of thy cry; for the mighty man hath stumbled against the mighty, they are fallen both of them together. {P}

13.hebrew: הַדָּבָר אֲשֶׁר דִּבֶּר יְהוָה, אֶל-יִרְמְיָהוּ הַנָּבִיא--לָבוֹא, נְבוּכַדְרֶאצַּר מֶלֶךְ בָּבֶל, לְהַכּוֹת, אֶת-אֶרֶץ מִצְרָיִם.
13.english: The word that the LORD spoke to Jeremiah the prophet, how that Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon should come and smite the land of Egypt.

14.hebrew: הַגִּידוּ בְמִצְרַיִם וְהַשְׁמִיעוּ בְמִגְדּוֹל, וְהַשְׁמִיעוּ בְנֹף וּבְתַחְפַּנְחֵס; אִמְרוּ, הִתְיַצֵּב וְהָכֵן לָךְ--כִּי-אָכְלָה חֶרֶב, סְבִיבֶיךָ.
14.english: Declare ye in Egypt, and announce in Migdol, and announce in Noph and in Tahpanhes; say ye: 'Stand forth, and prepare thee, for the sword hath devoured round about thee.'

15.hebrew: מַדּוּעַ, נִסְחַף אַבִּירֶיךָ:  לֹא עָמַד, כִּי יְהוָה הֲדָפוֹ.
15.english: Why is thy strong one overthrown? He stood not, because the LORD did thrust him down.

16.hebrew: הִרְבָּה, כּוֹשֵׁל; גַּם-נָפַל אִישׁ אֶל-רֵעֵהוּ, וַיֹּאמְרוּ קוּמָה וְנָשֻׁבָה אֶל-עַמֵּנוּ וְאֶל-אֶרֶץ מוֹלַדְתֵּנוּ, מִפְּנֵי, חֶרֶב הַיּוֹנָה.
16.english: He made many to stumble; yea, they fell one upon another, and said: 'Arise, and let us return to our own people, and to the land of our birth, from the oppressing sword.'

17.hebrew: קָרְאוּ, שָׁם, פַּרְעֹה מֶלֶךְ-מִצְרַיִם שָׁאוֹן, הֶעֱבִיר הַמּוֹעֵד.
17.english: They cried there: 'Pharaoh king of Egypt is but a noise; he hath let the appointed time pass by.'

18.hebrew: חַי-אָנִי, נְאֻם-הַמֶּלֶךְ--יְהוָה צְבָאוֹת, שְׁמוֹ:  כִּי כְּתָבוֹר בֶּהָרִים, וּכְכַרְמֶל בַּיָּם יָבוֹא.
18.english: As I live, saith the King, whose name is the LORD of hosts, surely like Tabor among the mountains, and like Carmel by the sea, so shall he come.

19.hebrew: כְּלֵי גוֹלָה עֲשִׂי לָךְ, יוֹשֶׁבֶת בַּת-מִצְרָיִם:  כִּי-נֹף לְשַׁמָּה תִהְיֶה, וְנִצְּתָה מֵאֵין יוֹשֵׁב.  {ס}
19.english: O thou daughter that dwellest in Egypt, furnish thyself to go into captivity; for Noph shall become a desolation, and shall be laid waste, without inhabitant. {S}

20.hebrew: עֶגְלָה יְפֵה-פִיָּה, מִצְרָיִם; קֶרֶץ מִצָּפוֹן, בָּא בָא.
20.english: Egypt is a very fair heifer; but the gadfly out of the north is come, it is come.

21.hebrew: גַּם-שְׂכִרֶיהָ בְקִרְבָּהּ כְּעֶגְלֵי מַרְבֵּק, כִּי-גַם-הֵמָּה הִפְנוּ נָסוּ יַחְדָּיו לֹא עָמָדוּ:  כִּי יוֹם אֵידָם בָּא עֲלֵיהֶם, עֵת פְּקֻדָּתָם.
21.english: Also her mercenaries in the midst of her are like calves of the stall, for they also are turned back, they are fled away together, they did not stand; for the day of their calamity is come upon them, the time of their visitation.

22.hebrew: קוֹלָהּ, כַּנָּחָשׁ יֵלֵךְ:  כִּי-בְחַיִל יֵלֵכוּ--וּבְקַרְדֻּמּוֹת בָּאוּ לָהּ, כְּחֹטְבֵי עֵצִים.
22.english: The sound thereof shall go like the serpent's; for they march with an army, and come against her with axes, as hewers of wood.

23.hebrew: כָּרְתוּ יַעְרָהּ נְאֻם-יְהוָה, כִּי לֹא יֵחָקֵר:  כִּי רַבּוּ מֵאַרְבֶּה, וְאֵין לָהֶם מִסְפָּר.
23.english: They cut down her forest, saith the LORD, though it cannot be searched; because they are more than the locusts, and are innumerable.

24.hebrew: הֹבִישָׁה, בַּת-מִצְרָיִם; נִתְּנָה, בְּיַד עַם-צָפוֹן.
24.english: The daughter of Egypt is put to shame; she is delivered into the hand of the people of the north.

25.hebrew: אָמַר יְהוָה צְבָאוֹת אֱלֹהֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל, הִנְנִי פוֹקֵד אֶל-אָמוֹן מִנֹּא, וְעַל-פַּרְעֹה וְעַל-מִצְרַיִם, וְעַל-אֱלֹהֶיהָ וְעַל-מְלָכֶיהָ; וְעַל-פַּרְעֹה--וְעַל הַבֹּטְחִים, בּוֹ.
25.english: The LORD of hosts, the God of Israel, saith: Behold, I will punish Amon of No, and Pharaoh, and Egypt, with her gods, and her kings; even Pharaoh, and them that trust in him;

26.hebrew: וּנְתַתִּים, בְּיַד מְבַקְשֵׁי נַפְשָׁם, וּבְיַד נְבוּכַדְרֶאצַּר מֶלֶךְ-בָּבֶל, וּבְיַד-עֲבָדָיו; וְאַחֲרֵי-כֵן תִּשְׁכֹּן כִּימֵי-קֶדֶם, נְאֻם-יְהוָה.  {פ}
26.english: and I will deliver them into the hand of those that seek their lives, and into the hand of Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon, and into the hand of his servants; and afterwards it shall be inhabited, as in the days of old, saith the LORD. {P}

27.hebrew: וְאַתָּה אַל-תִּירָא עַבְדִּי יַעֲקֹב, וְאַל-תֵּחַת יִשְׂרָאֵל--כִּי הִנְנִי מוֹשִׁעֲךָ מֵרָחוֹק, וְאֶת-זַרְעֲךָ מֵאֶרֶץ שִׁבְיָם; וְשָׁב יַעֲקוֹב וְשָׁקַט וְשַׁאֲנַן, וְאֵין מַחֲרִיד.
27.english: But fear not thou, O Jacob My servant, neither be dismayed, O Israel; for, lo, I will save thee from afar, and thy seed from the land of their captivity; and Jacob shall again be quiet and at ease, and none shall make him afraid.

28.hebrew: אַתָּה אַל-תִּירָא עַבְדִּי יַעֲקֹב, נְאֻם-יְהוָה--כִּי אִתְּךָ, אָנִי:  כִּי אֶעֱשֶׂה כָלָה בְּכָל-הַגּוֹיִם אֲשֶׁר הִדַּחְתִּיךָ שָּׁמָּה, וְאֹתְךָ לֹא-אֶעֱשֶׂה כָלָה, וְיִסַּרְתִּיךָ לַמִּשְׁפָּט, וְנַקֵּה לֹא אֲנַקֶּךָּ.  {פ}
28.english: Fear not thou, O Jacob My servant, saith the LORD, for I am with thee; for I will make a full end of all the nations whither I have driven thee, but I will not make a full end of thee; and I will correct thee in measure, but will not utterly destroy thee. {P}

1.hebrew: אֲשֶׁר הָיָה דְבַר-יְהוָה אֶל-יִרְמְיָהוּ הַנָּבִיא, אֶל-פְּלִשְׁתִּים, בְּטֶרֶם יַכֶּה פַרְעֹה, אֶת-עַזָּה.
1.english: The word of the LORD that came to Jeremiah the prophet concerning the Philistines, before that Pharaoh smote Gaza.

2.hebrew: כֹּה אָמַר יְהוָה, הִנֵּה-מַיִם עֹלִים מִצָּפוֹן וְהָיוּ לְנַחַל שׁוֹטֵף, וְיִשְׁטְפוּ אֶרֶץ וּמְלוֹאָהּ, עִיר וְיֹשְׁבֵי בָהּ; וְזָעֲקוּ, הָאָדָם, וְהֵילִל, כֹּל יוֹשֵׁב הָאָרֶץ.
2.english: Thus saith the LORD: behold, waters rise up out of the north, and shall become an overflowing stream, and they shall overflow the land and all that is therein, the city and them that dwell therein; and the men shall cry, and all the inhabitants of the land shall wail.

3.hebrew: מִקּוֹל, שַׁעֲטַת פַּרְסוֹת אַבִּירָיו, מֵרַעַשׁ לְרִכְבּוֹ, הֲמוֹן גַּלְגִּלָּיו--לֹא-הִפְנוּ אָבוֹת אֶל-בָּנִים, מֵרִפְיוֹן יָדָיִם.
3.english: At the noise of the stamping of the hoofs of his strong ones, at the rushing of his chariots, at the rumbling of his wheels, the fathers look not back to their children for feebleness of hands;

4.hebrew: עַל-הַיּוֹם, הַבָּא לִשְׁדוֹד אֶת-כָּל-פְּלִשְׁתִּים, לְהַכְרִית לְצֹר וּלְצִידוֹן, כֹּל שָׂרִיד עֹזֵר:  כִּי-שֹׁדֵד יְהוָה אֶת-פְּלִשְׁתִּים, שְׁאֵרִית אִי כַפְתּוֹר.
4.english: Because of the day that cometh to spoil all the Philistines, to cut off from Tyre and Zidon every helper that remaineth; for the LORD will spoil the Philistines, the remnant of the isle of Caphtor.

5.hebrew: בָּאָה קָרְחָה אֶל-עַזָּה, נִדְמְתָה אַשְׁקְלוֹן שְׁאֵרִית עִמְקָם; עַד-מָתַי, תִּתְגּוֹדָדִי.
5.english: Baldness is come upon Gaza, Ashkelon is brought to nought, the remnant of their valley; how long wilt thou cut thyself?

6.hebrew: הוֹי, חֶרֶב לַיהוָה, עַד-אָנָה, לֹא תִשְׁקֹטִי; הֵאָסְפִי, אֶל-תַּעְרֵךְ--הֵרָגְעִי, וָדֹמִּי.
6.english: O thou sword of the LORD, how long will it be ere thou be quiet? Put up thyself into thy scabbard, rest, and be still.

7.hebrew: אֵיךְ תִּשְׁקֹטִי, וַיהוָה צִוָּה-לָהּ:  אֶל-אַשְׁקְלוֹן וְאֶל-חוֹף הַיָּם, שָׁם יְעָדָהּ.  {פ}
7.english: How canst thou be quiet? for the LORD hath given it a charge; against Ashkelon, and against the sea-shore, there hath He appointed it. {P}

1.hebrew: לְמוֹאָב כֹּה-אָמַר יְהוָה צְבָאוֹת אֱלֹהֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל, הוֹי אֶל-נְבוֹ כִּי שֻׁדָּדָה, הֹבִישָׁה נִלְכְּדָה, קִרְיָתָיִם; הֹבִישָׁה הַמִּשְׂגָּב, וָחָתָּה.
1.english: Of Moab. Thus saith the LORD of hosts, the God of Israel: Woe unto Nebo! for it is spoiled; Kiriathaim is put to shame, it is taken; Misgab is put to shame and dismayed.

2.hebrew: אֵין עוֹד, תְּהִלַּת מוֹאָב--בְּחֶשְׁבּוֹן חָשְׁבוּ עָלֶיהָ רָעָה, לְכוּ וְנַכְרִיתֶנָּה מִגּוֹי; גַּם-מַדְמֵן תִּדֹּמִּי, אַחֲרַיִךְ תֵּלֶךְ חָרֶב.
2.english: The praise of Moab is no more; in Heshbon they have devised evil against her: 'Come, and let us cut her off from being a nation.' Thou also, O Madmen, shalt be brought to silence; the sword shall pursue thee.

3.hebrew: קוֹל צְעָקָה, מֵחֹרוֹנָיִם--שֹׁד, וָשֶׁבֶר גָּדוֹל.
3.english: Hark! a cry from Horonaim, spoiling and great destruction!

4.hebrew: נִשְׁבְּרָה, מוֹאָב; הִשְׁמִיעוּ זְּעָקָה, צעוריה (צְעִירֶיהָ).
4.english: Moab is destroyed; her little ones have caused a cry to be heard.

5.hebrew: כִּי מַעֲלֵה הלחות (הַלֻּחִית), בִּבְכִי יַעֲלֶה-בֶּכִי:  כִּי בְּמוֹרַד חוֹרֹנַיִם, צָרֵי צַעֲקַת-שֶׁבֶר שָׁמֵעוּ.
5.english: For by the ascent of Luhith with continual weeping shall they go up; for in the going down of Horonaim they have heard the distressing cry of destruction.

6.hebrew: נֻסוּ, מַלְּטוּ נַפְשְׁכֶם; וְתִהְיֶינָה, כַּעֲרוֹעֵר בַּמִּדְבָּר.
6.english: Flee, save your lives, and be like a tamarisk in the wilderness.

7.hebrew: כִּי יַעַן בִּטְחֵךְ בְּמַעֲשַׂיִךְ, וּבְאוֹצְרוֹתַיִךְ, גַּם-אַתְּ, תִּלָּכֵדִי; וְיָצָא כמיש (כְמוֹשׁ) בַּגּוֹלָה, כֹּהֲנָיו וְשָׂרָיו יחד (יַחְדָּו).
7.english: For, because thou hast trusted in thy works and in thy treasures, thou also shalt be taken; and Chemosh shall go forth into captivity, his priests and his princes together.

8.hebrew: וְיָבֹא שֹׁדֵד אֶל-כָּל-עִיר, וְעִיר לֹא תִמָּלֵט, וְאָבַד הָעֵמֶק, וְנִשְׁמַד הַמִּישֹׁר--אֲשֶׁר, אָמַר יְהוָה.
8.english: And the spoiler shall come upon every city, and no city shall escape; the valley also shall perish, and the plain shall be destroyed; as the LORD hath spoken.

9.hebrew: תְּנוּ-צִיץ לְמוֹאָב, כִּי נָצֹא תֵּצֵא; וְעָרֶיהָ לְשַׁמָּה תִהְיֶינָה, מֵאֵין יוֹשֵׁב בָּהֵן.
9.english: Give wings unto Moab, for she must fly and get away; and her cities shall become a desolation, without any to dwell therein.

10.hebrew: אָרוּר, עֹשֶׂה מְלֶאכֶת יְהוָה--רְמִיָּה; וְאָרוּר, מֹנֵעַ חַרְבּוֹ מִדָּם.
10.english: Cursed be he that doeth the work of the LORD with a slack hand, and cursed be he that keepeth back his sword from blood.

11.hebrew: שַׁאֲנַן מוֹאָב מִנְּעוּרָיו, וְשֹׁקֵט הוּא אֶל-שְׁמָרָיו, וְלֹא-הוּרַק מִכְּלִי אֶל-כֶּלִי, וּבַגּוֹלָה לֹא הָלָךְ; עַל-כֵּן, עָמַד טַעְמוֹ בּוֹ, וְרֵיחוֹ, לֹא נָמָר.  {ס}
11.english: Moab hath been at ease from his youth, and he hath settled on his lees, and hath not been emptied from vessel to vessel, neither hath he gone into captivity; therefore his taste remaineth in him, and his scent is not changed. {S}

12.hebrew: לָכֵן הִנֵּה-יָמִים בָּאִים, נְאֻם-יְהוָה, וְשִׁלַּחְתִּי-לוֹ צֹעִים, וְצֵעֻהוּ; וְכֵלָיו יָרִיקוּ, וְנִבְלֵיהֶם יְנַפֵּצוּ.
12.english: Therefore, behold, the days come, saith the LORD, that I will send unto him them that tilt up, and they shall tilt him up; and they shall empty his vessels, and break their bottles in pieces.

13.hebrew: וּבֹשׁ מוֹאָב, מִכְּמוֹשׁ, כַּאֲשֶׁר-בֹּשׁוּ בֵּית יִשְׂרָאֵל, מִבֵּית אֵל מִבְטֶחָם.
13.english: And Moab shall be ashamed of Chemosh, as the house of Israel was ashamed of Beth-el their confidence.

14.hebrew: אֵיךְ, תֹּאמְרוּ, גִּבּוֹרִים, אֲנָחְנוּ; וְאַנְשֵׁי-חַיִל, לַמִּלְחָמָה.
14.english: How say ye: 'We are mighty men, and valiant men for the war'?

15.hebrew: שֻׁדַּד מוֹאָב וְעָרֶיהָ עָלָה, וּמִבְחַר בַּחוּרָיו יָרְדוּ לַטָּבַח:  נְאֻם-הַמֶּלֶךְ--יְהוָה צְבָאוֹת, שְׁמוֹ.
15.english: Moab is spoiled, and they are gone up into her cities, and his chosen young men are gone down to the slaughter, saith the King, whose name is the LORD of hosts.

16.hebrew: קָרוֹב אֵיד-מוֹאָב, לָבוֹא; וְרָעָתוֹ, מִהֲרָה מְאֹד.
16.english: The calamity of Moab is near to come, and his affliction hasteth fast.

17.hebrew: נֻדוּ לוֹ כָּל-סְבִיבָיו, וְכֹל יֹדְעֵי שְׁמוֹ; אִמְרוּ, אֵיכָה נִשְׁבַּר מַטֵּה-עֹז--מַקֵּל, תִּפְאָרָה.
17.english: Bemoan him, all ye that are round about him, and all ye that know his name; say: 'How is the strong staff broken, the beautiful rod!'

18.hebrew: רְדִי מִכָּבוֹד ישבי (וּשְׁבִי) בַצָּמָא, יֹשֶׁבֶת בַּת-דִּיבוֹן:  כִּי-שֹׁדֵד מוֹאָב עָלָה בָךְ, שִׁחֵת מִבְצָרָיִךְ.
18.english: O thou daughter that dwellest in Dibon, come down from thy glory, and sit in thirst; for the spoiler of Moab is come up against thee, he hath destroyed thy strongholds.

19.hebrew: אֶל-דֶּרֶךְ עִמְדִי וְצַפִּי, יוֹשֶׁבֶת עֲרוֹעֵר; שַׁאֲלִי-נָס וְנִמְלָטָה, אִמְרִי מַה-נִּהְיָתָה.
19.english: O inhabitant of Aroer, stand by the way, and watch; ask him that fleeth, and her that escapeth; say: 'What hath been done?'

20.hebrew: הֹבִישׁ מוֹאָב כִּי-חַתָּה, הילילי (הֵילִילוּ) וזעקי (וּזְעָקוּ); הַגִּידוּ בְאַרְנוֹן, כִּי שֻׁדַּד מוֹאָב.
20.english: Moab is put to shame, for it is dismayed; wail and cry; tell ye it in Arnon, that Moab is spoiled.

21.hebrew: וּמִשְׁפָּט בָּא, אֶל-אֶרֶץ הַמִּישֹׁר--אֶל-חֹלוֹן וְאֶל-יַהְצָה, וְעַל-מופעת (מֵיפָעַת).
21.english: And judgment is come upon the country of the Plain; upon Holon, and upon Jahzah, and upon Mephaath;

22.hebrew: וְעַל-דִּיבוֹן וְעַל-נְבוֹ, וְעַל-בֵּית דִּבְלָתָיִם.
22.english: and upon Dibon, and upon Nebo, and upon Beth-diblathaim;

23.hebrew: וְעַל קִרְיָתַיִם וְעַל-בֵּית גָּמוּל, וְעַל-בֵּית מְעוֹן.
23.english: and upon Kiriathaim, and upon Beth-gamul, and upon Beth-meon;

24.hebrew: וְעַל-קְרִיּוֹת, וְעַל-בָּצְרָה; וְעַל, כָּל-עָרֵי אֶרֶץ מוֹאָב--הָרְחֹקוֹת, וְהַקְּרֹבוֹת.
24.english: and upon Kerioth, and upon Bozrah, and upon all the cities of the land of Moab, far or near.

25.hebrew: נִגְדְּעָה קֶרֶן מוֹאָב, וּזְרֹעוֹ נִשְׁבָּרָה--נְאֻם, יְהוָה.
25.english: The horn of Moab is cut off, and his arm is broken, saith the LORD.

26.hebrew: הַשְׁכִּירֻהוּ, כִּי עַל-יְהוָה הִגְדִּיל; וְסָפַק מוֹאָב בְּקִיאוֹ, וְהָיָה לִשְׂחֹק גַּם-הוּא.
26.english: Make ye him drunken, for he magnified himself against the LORD; and Moab shall wallow in his vomit, and he also shall be in derision.

27.hebrew: וְאִם לוֹא הַשְּׂחֹק, הָיָה לְךָ יִשְׂרָאֵל, אִם-בְּגַנָּבִים, נמצאה (נִמְצָא):  כִּי-מִדֵּי דְבָרֶיךָ בּוֹ, תִּתְנוֹדָד.
27.english: For was not Israel a derision unto thee? Was he found among thieves? For as often as thou speakest of him, thou waggest the head.

28.hebrew: עִזְבוּ עָרִים וְשִׁכְנוּ בַּסֶּלַע, יֹשְׁבֵי מוֹאָב; וִהְיוּ כְיוֹנָה, תְּקַנֵּן בְּעֶבְרֵי פִי-פָחַת.
28.english: O ye that dwell in Moab, leave the cities, and dwell in the rock; and be like the dove that maketh her nest in the sides of the pit's mouth.

29.hebrew: שָׁמַעְנוּ גְאוֹן-מוֹאָב, גֵּאֶה מְאֹד:  גָּבְהוֹ וּגְאוֹנוֹ וְגַאֲוָתוֹ, וְרֻם לִבּוֹ.
29.english: We have heard of the pride of Moab; he is very proud; his loftiness, and his pride, and his haughtiness, and the assumption of his heart.

30.hebrew: אֲנִי יָדַעְתִּי נְאֻם-יְהוָה, עֶבְרָתוֹ וְלֹא-כֵן; בַּדָּיו, לֹא-כֵן עָשׂוּ.
30.english: I know his arrogancy, saith the LORD, that it is ill-founded; his boastings have wrought nothing well-founded.

31.hebrew: עַל-כֵּן עַל-מוֹאָב אֲיֵלִיל, וּלְמוֹאָב כֻּלֹּה אֶזְעָק:  אֶל-אַנְשֵׁי קִיר-חֶרֶשׂ, יֶהְגֶּה.
31.english: Therefore will I wail for Moab; yea, I will cry out for all Moab; for the men of Kir-heres shall my heart moan.

32.hebrew: מִבְּכִי יַעְזֵר אֶבְכֶּה-לָּךְ, הַגֶּפֶן שִׂבְמָה, נְטִישֹׁתַיִךְ עָבְרוּ יָם, עַד יָם יַעְזֵר נָגָעוּ--עַל-קֵיצֵךְ וְעַל-בְּצִירֵךְ, שֹׁדֵד נָפָל.
32.english: With more than the weeping of Jazer will I weep for thee, O vine of Sibmah; thy branches passed over the sea, they reached even to the sea of Jazer; upon thy summer fruits and upon thy vintage the spoiler is fallen.

33.hebrew: וְנֶאֶסְפָה שִׂמְחָה וָגִיל מִכַּרְמֶל, וּמֵאֶרֶץ מוֹאָב; וְיַיִן, מִיקָבִים הִשְׁבַּתִּי--לֹא-יִדְרֹךְ הֵידָד, הֵידָד לֹא הֵידָד.
33.english: And gladness and joy is taken away from the fruitful field, and from the land of Moab; and I have caused wine to cease from the winepresses; none shall tread with shouting; the shouting shall be no shouting.

34.hebrew: מִזַּעֲקַת חֶשְׁבּוֹן עַד-אֶלְעָלֵה, עַד-יַהַץ נָתְנוּ קוֹלָם--מִצֹּעַר עַד-חֹרֹנַיִם, עֶגְלַת שְׁלִשִׁיָּה:  כִּי גַּם-מֵי נִמְרִים, לִמְשַׁמּוֹת יִהְיוּ.
34.english: From the cry of Heshbon even unto Elealeh, even unto Jahaz have they uttered their voice, from Zoar even unto Horonaim, a heifer of three years old; for the Waters of Nimrim also shall be desolate.

35.hebrew: וְהִשְׁבַּתִּי לְמוֹאָב, נְאֻם-יְהוָה, מַעֲלֶה בָמָה, וּמַקְטִיר לֵאלֹהָיו.
35.english: Moreover I will cause to cease in Moab, saith the LORD, him that offereth in the high place, and him that offereth to his gods.

36.hebrew: עַל-כֵּן לִבִּי לְמוֹאָב, כַּחֲלִלִים יֶהֱמֶה, וְלִבִּי אֶל-אַנְשֵׁי קִיר-חֶרֶשׂ, כַּחֲלִילִים יֶהֱמֶה; עַל-כֵּן יִתְרַת עָשָׂה, אָבָדוּ.
36.english: Therefore my heart moaneth for Moab like pipes, and my heart moaneth like pipes for the men of Kir-heres; therefore the abundance that he hath gotten is perished.

37.hebrew: כִּי כָל-רֹאשׁ קָרְחָה, וְכָל-זָקָן גְּרֻעָה; עַל כָּל-יָדַיִם גְּדֻדֹת, וְעַל-מָתְנַיִם שָׂק.
37.english: For every head is bald, and every beard clipped; upon all the hands are cuttings, and upon the loins sackcloth.

38.hebrew: עַל כָּל-גַּגּוֹת מוֹאָב וּבִרְחֹבֹתֶיהָ, כֻּלֹּה מִסְפֵּד:  כִּי-שָׁבַרְתִּי אֶת-מוֹאָב, כִּכְלִי אֵין-חֵפֶץ בּוֹ--נְאֻם-יְהוָה.
38.english: On all the housetops of Moab and in the broad places thereof there is lamentation every where; for I have broken Moab like a vessel wherein is no pleasure, saith the LORD.

39.hebrew: אֵיךְ חַתָּה הֵילִילוּ, אֵיךְ הִפְנָה-עֹרֶף מוֹאָב בּוֹשׁ; וְהָיָה מוֹאָב לִשְׂחֹק וְלִמְחִתָּה, לְכָל-סְבִיבָיו.  {ס}
39.english: 'How is it broken down!' wail ye! 'How hath Moab turned the back with shame!' so shall Moab become a derision and a dismay to all that are round about him. {S}

40.hebrew: כִּי-כֹה אָמַר יְהוָה, הִנֵּה כַנֶּשֶׁר יִדְאֶה; וּפָרַשׂ כְּנָפָיו, אֶל-מוֹאָב.
40.english: For thus saith the LORD: Behold, he shall swoop as a vulture, and shall spread out his wings against Moab.

41.hebrew: נִלְכְּדָה, הַקְּרִיּוֹת, וְהַמְּצָדוֹת, נִתְפָּשָׂה; וְהָיָה לֵב גִּבּוֹרֵי מוֹאָב, בַּיּוֹם הַהוּא, כְּלֵב, אִשָּׁה מְצֵרָה.
41.english: The cities are taken, and the strongholds are seized, and the heart of the mighty men of Moab at that day shall be as the heart of a woman in her pangs.

42.hebrew: וְנִשְׁמַד מוֹאָב, מֵעָם:  כִּי עַל-יְהוָה, הִגְדִּיל.
42.english: And Moab shall be destroyed from being a people, because he hath magnified himself against the LORD.

43.hebrew: פַּחַד וָפַחַת, וָפָח--עָלֶיךָ יוֹשֵׁב מוֹאָב, נְאֻם-יְהוָה.
43.english: Terror, and the pit, and the trap, are upon thee, O inhabitant of Moab, saith the LORD.

44.hebrew: הניס (הַנָּס) מִפְּנֵי הַפַּחַד, יִפֹּל אֶל-הַפַּחַת, וְהָעֹלֶה מִן-הַפַּחַת, יִלָּכֵד בַּפָּח:  כִּי-אָבִיא אֵלֶיהָ אֶל-מוֹאָב שְׁנַת פְּקֻדָּתָם, נְאֻם-יְהוָה.
44.english: He that fleeth from the terror shall fall into the pit; and he that getteth up out of the pit shall be taken in the trap; for I will bring upon her, even upon Moab, the year of their visitation, saith the LORD.

45.hebrew: בְּצֵל חֶשְׁבּוֹן עָמְדוּ, מִכֹּחַ נָסִים:  כִּי-אֵשׁ יָצָא מֵחֶשְׁבּוֹן, וְלֶהָבָה מִבֵּין סִיחוֹן, וַתֹּאכַל פְּאַת מוֹאָב, וְקָדְקֹד בְּנֵי שָׁאוֹן.
45.english: In the shadow of Heshbon the fugitives stand without strength; for a fire is gone forth out of Heshbon, and a flame from the midst of Sihon, and it devoureth the corner of Moab, and the crown of the head of the tumultuous ones.

46.hebrew: אוֹי-לְךָ מוֹאָב, אָבַד עַם-כְּמוֹשׁ:  כִּי-לֻקְּחוּ בָנֶיךָ בַּשֶּׁבִי, וּבְנֹתֶיךָ בַּשִּׁבְיָה.
46.english: Woe unto thee, O Moab! The people of Chemosh is undone; for thy sons are taken away captive, and thy daughters into captivity.

47.hebrew: וְשַׁבְתִּי שְׁבוּת-מוֹאָב בְּאַחֲרִית הַיָּמִים, נְאֻם-יְהוָה; עַד-הֵנָּה, מִשְׁפַּט מוֹאָב.  {ס}
47.english: Yet will I turn the captivity of Moab in the end of days, saith the LORD. Thus far is the judgment of Moab. {S}

1.hebrew: לִבְנֵי עַמּוֹן, כֹּה אָמַר יְהוָה, הֲבָנִים אֵין לְיִשְׂרָאֵל, אִם-יוֹרֵשׁ אֵין לוֹ--מַדּוּעַ, יָרַשׁ מַלְכָּם אֶת-גָּד, וְעַמּוֹ, בְּעָרָיו יָשָׁב.
1.english: Of the children of Ammon. Thus saith the LORD: Hath Israel no sons? Hath he no heir? Why then doth Malcam take possession of Gad, and his people dwell in the cities thereof?

2.hebrew: לָכֵן הִנֵּה יָמִים בָּאִים נְאֻם-יְהוָה, וְהִשְׁמַעְתִּי אֶל-רַבַּת בְּנֵי-עַמּוֹן תְּרוּעַת מִלְחָמָה וְהָיְתָה לְתֵל שְׁמָמָה, וּבְנֹתֶיהָ, בָּאֵשׁ תִּצַּתְנָה; וְיָרַשׁ יִשְׂרָאֵל אֶת-יֹרְשָׁיו, אָמַר יְהוָה.
2.english: Therefore, behold, the days come, saith the LORD, that I will cause an alarm of war to be heard against Rabbah of the children of Ammon; and it shall become a desolate mound, and her daughters shall be burned with fire; then shall Israel dispossess them that did dispossess him, saith the LORD.

3.hebrew: הֵילִילִי חֶשְׁבּוֹן כִּי שֻׁדְּדָה-עַי, צְעַקְנָה בְּנוֹת רַבָּה--חֲגֹרְנָה שַׂקִּים, סְפֹדְנָה וְהִתְשׁוֹטַטְנָה בַּגְּדֵרוֹת:  כִּי מַלְכָּם בַּגּוֹלָה יֵלֵךְ, כֹּהֲנָיו וְשָׂרָיו יַחְדָּיו.
3.english: Wail, O Heshbon, for Ai is undone; cry, ye daughters of Rabbah, gird you with sackcloth; lament, and run to and fro among the folds; for Malcam shall go into captivity, his priests and his princes together.

4.hebrew: מַה-תִּתְהַלְלִי, בָּעֲמָקִים--זָב עִמְקֵךְ, הַבַּת הַשּׁוֹבֵבָה; הַבֹּטְחָה, בְּאֹצְרֹתֶיהָ, מִי, יָבוֹא אֵלָי.
4.english: Wherefore gloriest thou in the valleys, thy flowing valley, O backsliding daughter? that didst trust in thy treasures: 'Who shall come unto me?'

5.hebrew: הִנְנִי מֵבִיא עָלַיִךְ פַּחַד, נְאֻם-אֲדֹנָי יְהוִה צְבָאוֹת--מִכָּל-סְבִיבָיִךְ; וְנִדַּחְתֶּם אִישׁ לְפָנָיו, וְאֵין מְקַבֵּץ לַנֹּדֵד.
5.english: Behold, I will bring a terror upon thee, saith the Lord GOD of hosts, from all that are round about thee; and ye shall be driven out every man right forth, and there shall be none to gather up him that wandereth.

6.hebrew: וְאַחֲרֵי-כֵן, אָשִׁיב אֶת-שְׁבוּת בְּנֵי-עַמּוֹן--נְאֻם-יְהוָה.  {פ}
6.english: But afterward I will bring back the captivity of the children of Ammon, saith the LORD. {P}

7.hebrew: לֶאֱדוֹם, כֹּה אָמַר יְהוָה צְבָאוֹת, הַאֵין עוֹד חָכְמָה, בְּתֵימָן; אָבְדָה עֵצָה מִבָּנִים, נִסְרְחָה חָכְמָתָם.
7.english: Of Edom. Thus saith the LORD of hosts: Is wisdom no more in Teman? Is counsel perished from the prudent? Is their wisdom vanished?

8.hebrew: נֻסוּ הָפְנוּ הֶעְמִיקוּ לָשֶׁבֶת, יֹשְׁבֵי דְּדָן:  כִּי אֵיד עֵשָׂו הֵבֵאתִי עָלָיו, עֵת פְּקַדְתִּיו.
8.english: Flee ye, turn back, dwell deep, O inhabitants of Dedan; for I do bring the calamity of Esau upon him, the time that I shall punish him.

9.hebrew: אִם-בֹּצְרִים בָּאוּ לָךְ, לֹא יַשְׁאִרוּ עוֹלֵלוֹת; אִם-גַּנָּבִים בַּלַּיְלָה, הִשְׁחִיתוּ דַיָּם.
9.english: If grape-gatherers came to thee, would they not leave some gleaning grapes? if thieves by night, would they not destroy till they had enough?

10.hebrew: כִּי-אֲנִי חָשַׂפְתִּי אֶת-עֵשָׂו, גִּלֵּיתִי אֶת-מִסְתָּרָיו, וְנֶחְבָּה, לֹא יוּכָל; שֻׁדַּד זַרְעוֹ וְאֶחָיו וּשְׁכֵנָיו, וְאֵינֶנּוּ.
10.english: But I have made Esau bare, I have uncovered his secret places, and he shall not be able to hide himself; his seed is spoiled, and his brethren, and his neighbours, and he is not.

11.hebrew: עָזְבָה יְתֹמֶיךָ, אֲנִי אֲחַיֶּה; וְאַלְמְנוֹתֶיךָ, עָלַי תִּבְטָחוּ.  {ס}
11.english: Leave thy fatherless children, I will rear them, and let thy widows trust in Me. {S}

12.hebrew: כִּי-כֹה אָמַר יְהוָה, הִנֵּה אֲשֶׁר-אֵין מִשְׁפָּטָם לִשְׁתּוֹת הַכּוֹס שָׁתוֹ יִשְׁתּוּ, וְאַתָּה הוּא, נָקֹה תִּנָּקֶה:  לֹא תִנָּקֶה, כִּי שָׁתֹה תִּשְׁתֶּה.
12.english: For thus saith the LORD: Behold, they to whom it pertained not to drink of the cup shall assuredly drink; and art thou he that shall altogether go unpunished? thou shalt not go unpunished, but thou shalt surely drink.

13.hebrew: כִּי בִי נִשְׁבַּעְתִּי נְאֻם-יְהוָה, כִּי-לְשַׁמָּה לְחֶרְפָּה לְחֹרֶב וְלִקְלָלָה תִּהְיֶה בָצְרָה; וְכָל-עָרֶיהָ תִהְיֶינָה, לְחָרְבוֹת עוֹלָם.
13.english: For I have sworn by Myself, saith the LORD, that Bozrah shall become an astonishment, a reproach, a waste, and a curse; and all the cities thereof shall be perpetual wastes.

14.hebrew: שְׁמוּעָה שָׁמַעְתִּי מֵאֵת יְהוָה, וְצִיר בַּגּוֹיִם שָׁלוּחַ; הִתְקַבְּצוּ וּבֹאוּ עָלֶיהָ, וְקוּמוּ לַמִּלְחָמָה.
14.english: I have heard a message from the LORD, and an ambassador is sent among the nations: 'Gather yourselves together, and come against her, and rise up to the battle.'

15.hebrew: כִּי-הִנֵּה קָטֹן נְתַתִּיךָ, בַּגּוֹיִם--בָּזוּי, בָּאָדָם.
15.english: For, behold, I make thee small among the nations, and despised among men.

16.hebrew: תִּפְלַצְתְּךָ הִשִּׁיא אֹתָךְ, זְדוֹן לִבֶּךָ, שֹׁכְנִי בְּחַגְוֵי הַסֶּלַע, תֹּפְשִׂי מְרוֹם גִּבְעָה:  כִּי-תַגְבִּיהַּ כַּנֶּשֶׁר קִנֶּךָ, מִשָּׁם אוֹרִידְךָ נְאֻם-יְהוָה.
16.english: Thy terribleness hath deceived thee, even the pride of thy heart, O thou that dwellest in the clefts of the rock, that holdest the height of the hill; though thou shouldest make thy nest as high as the eagle, I will bring thee down from thence, saith the LORD.

17.hebrew: וְהָיְתָה אֱדוֹם, לְשַׁמָּה; כֹּל עֹבֵר עָלֶיהָ, יִשֹּׁם וְיִשְׁרֹק עַל-כָּל-מַכּוֹתֶהָ.
17.english: And Edom shall become an astonishment; every one that passeth by it shall be astonished and shall hiss at all the plagues thereof.

18.hebrew: כְּמַהְפֵּכַת סְדֹם וַעֲמֹרָה, וּשְׁכֵנֶיהָ--אָמַר יְהוָה; לֹא-יֵשֵׁב שָׁם אִישׁ, וְלֹא-יָגוּר בָּהּ בֶּן-אָדָם.
18.english: As in the overthrow of Sodom and Gomorrah and the neighbour cities thereof, saith the LORD, no man shall abide there, neither shall any son of man dwell therein.

19.hebrew: הִנֵּה כְּאַרְיֵה יַעֲלֶה מִגְּאוֹן הַיַּרְדֵּן, אֶל-נְוֵה אֵיתָן--כִּי-אַרְגִּיעָה אֲרִיצֶנּוּ מֵעָלֶיהָ, וּמִי בָחוּר אֵלֶיהָ אֶפְקֹד:  כִּי מִי כָמוֹנִי, וּמִי יֹעִידֶנִּי, וּמִי-זֶה רֹעֶה, אֲשֶׁר יַעֲמֹד לְפָנָי.  {ס}
19.english: Behold, he shall come up like a lion from the thickets of the Jordan against the strong habitation; for I will suddenly make him run away from it, and whoso is chosen, him will I appoint over it; for who is like Me? and who will appoint Me a time? and who is that shepherd that will stand before Me? {S}

20.hebrew: לָכֵן שִׁמְעוּ עֲצַת-יְהוָה, אֲשֶׁר יָעַץ אֶל-אֱדוֹם, וּמַחְשְׁבוֹתָיו, אֲשֶׁר חָשַׁב אֶל-יֹשְׁבֵי תֵימָן:  אִם-לוֹא יִסְחָבוּם צְעִירֵי הַצֹּאן, אִם-לֹא יַשִּׁים עֲלֵיהֶם נְוֵהֶם.
20.english: Therefore hear ye the counsel of the LORD, that He hath taken against Edom; and His purposes, that He hath purposed against the inhabitants of Teman: surely the least of the flock shall drag them away, surely their habitation shall be appalled at them.

21.hebrew: מִקּוֹל נִפְלָם, רָעֲשָׁה הָאָרֶץ:  צְעָקָה, בְּיַם-סוּף נִשְׁמַע קוֹלָהּ.
21.english: The earth quaketh at the noise of their fall; there is a cry, the noise whereof is heard in the Red Sea.

22.hebrew: הִנֵּה כַנֶּשֶׁר יַעֲלֶה וְיִדְאֶה, וְיִפְרֹשׂ כְּנָפָיו עַל-בָּצְרָה; וְהָיָה לֵב גִּבּוֹרֵי אֱדוֹם, בַּיּוֹם הַהוּא, כְּלֵב, אִשָּׁה מְצֵרָה.  {פ}
22.english: Behold, he shall come up and swoop down as the vulture, and spread out his wings against Bozrah; and the heart of the mighty men of Edom at that day shall be as the heart of a woman in her pangs. {P}

23.hebrew: לְדַמֶּשֶׂק, בּוֹשָׁה חֲמָת וְאַרְפָּד--כִּי-שְׁמֻעָה רָעָה שָׁמְעוּ, נָמֹגוּ; בַּיָּם דְּאָגָה, הַשְׁקֵט לֹא יוּכָל.
23.english: Of Damascus. Hamath is ashamed, and Arpad; for they have heard evil tidings, they are melted away; there is trouble in the sea; it cannot be quiet.

24.hebrew: רָפְתָה דַמֶּשֶׂק הִפְנְתָה לָנוּס, וְרֶטֶט הֶחֱזִיקָה; צָרָה וַחֲבָלִים אֲחָזַתָּה, כַּיּוֹלֵדָה.
24.english: Damascus is waxed feeble, she turneth herself to flee, and trembling hath seized on her; anguish and pangs have taken hold of her, as of a woman in travail.

25.hebrew: אֵיךְ לֹא-עֻזְּבָה, עִיר תהלה (תְּהִלָּת)--קִרְיַת, מְשׂוֹשִׂי.
25.english: 'How is the city of praise left unrepaired, the city of my joy?'

26.hebrew: לָכֵן יִפְּלוּ בַחוּרֶיהָ, בִּרְחֹבֹתֶיהָ; וְכָל-אַנְשֵׁי הַמִּלְחָמָה יִדַּמּוּ בַּיּוֹם הַהוּא, נְאֻם יְהוָה צְבָאוֹת.
26.english: Therefore her young men shall fall in her broad places, and all the men of war shall be brought to silence in that day, saith the LORD of hosts.

27.hebrew: וְהִצַּתִּי אֵשׁ, בְּחוֹמַת דַּמָּשֶׂק; וְאָכְלָה, אַרְמְנוֹת בֶּן-הֲדָד.  {פ}
27.english: And I will kindle a fire in the wall of Damascus, and it shall devour the palaces of Ben-hadad. {P}

28.hebrew: לְקֵדָר וּלְמַמְלְכוֹת חָצוֹר, אֲשֶׁר הִכָּה נבוכדראצור (נְבוּכַדְרֶאצַּר) מֶלֶךְ-בָּבֶל--כֹּה, אָמַר יְהוָה:  קוּמוּ עֲלוּ אֶל-קֵדָר, וְשָׁדְדוּ אֶת-בְּנֵי-קֶדֶם.
28.english: Of Kedar, and of the kingdoms of Hazor, which Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon smote. Thus saith the LORD: Arise ye, go up against Kedar, and spoil the children of the east.

29.hebrew: אָהֳלֵיהֶם וְצֹאנָם יִקָּחוּ, יְרִיעוֹתֵיהֶם וְכָל-כְּלֵיהֶם וּגְמַלֵּיהֶם יִשְׂאוּ לָהֶם; וְקָרְאוּ עֲלֵיהֶם מָגוֹר, מִסָּבִיב.
29.english: Their tents and their flocks shall they take, they shall carry away for themselves their curtains, and all their vessels, and their camels; and they shall proclaim against them a terror on every side.

30.hebrew: נֻסוּ נֻּדוּ מְאֹד הֶעְמִיקוּ לָשֶׁבֶת, יֹשְׁבֵי חָצוֹר--נְאֻם-יְהוָה:  כִּי-יָעַץ עֲלֵיכֶם נְבוּכַדְרֶאצַּר מֶלֶךְ-בָּבֶל, עֵצָה, וְחָשַׁב עליהם (עֲלֵיכֶם), מַחֲשָׁבָה.
30.english: Flee ye, flit far off, dwell deep, O ye inhabitants of Hazor, saith the LORD; for Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon hath taken counsel against you, and hath conceived a purpose against you.

31.hebrew: קוּמוּ עֲלוּ, אֶל-גּוֹי שְׁלֵיו יוֹשֵׁב לָבֶטַח--נְאֻם-יְהוָה; לֹא-דְלָתַיִם וְלֹא-בְרִיחַ לוֹ, בָּדָד יִשְׁכֹּנוּ.
31.english: Arise, get you up against a nation that is at ease, that dwelleth without care, saith the LORD; that have neither gates nor bars, that dwell alone.

32.hebrew: וְהָיוּ גְמַלֵּיהֶם לָבַז, וַהֲמוֹן מִקְנֵיהֶם לְשָׁלָל, וְזֵרִתִים לְכָל-רוּחַ, קְצוּצֵי פֵאָה; וּמִכָּל-עֲבָרָיו אָבִיא אֶת-אֵידָם, נְאֻם-יְהוָה.
32.english: And their camels shall be a booty, and the multitude of their cattle a spoil; and I will scatter unto all winds them that have the corners polled; and I will bring their calamity from every side of them, saith the LORD.

33.hebrew: וְהָיְתָה חָצוֹר לִמְעוֹן תַּנִּים, שְׁמָמָה--עַד-עוֹלָם:  לֹא-יֵשֵׁב שָׁם אִישׁ, וְלֹא-יָגוּר בָּהּ בֶּן-אָדָם.  {ס}
33.english: And Hazor shall be a dwelling-place of jackals, a desolation for ever; no man shall abide there, neither shall any son of man dwell therein. {S}

34.hebrew: אֲשֶׁר הָיָה דְבַר-יְהוָה אֶל-יִרְמְיָהוּ הַנָּבִיא, אֶל-עֵילָם:  בְּרֵאשִׁית, מַלְכוּת צִדְקִיָּה מֶלֶךְ-יְהוּדָה--לֵאמֹר.
34.english: The word of the LORD that came to Jeremiah the prophet concerning Elam in the beginning of the reign of Zedekiah king of Judah, saying:

35.hebrew: כֹּה אָמַר יְהוָה צְבָאוֹת, הִנְנִי שֹׁבֵר אֶת-קֶשֶׁת עֵילָם, רֵאשִׁית, גְּבוּרָתָם.
35.english: Thus saith the LORD of hosts: behold, I will break the bow of Elam, the chief of their might.

36.hebrew: וְהֵבֵאתִי אֶל-עֵילָם אַרְבַּע רוּחוֹת, מֵאַרְבַּע קְצוֹת הַשָּׁמַיִם, וְזֵרִתִים, לְכֹל הָרֻחוֹת הָאֵלֶּה; וְלֹא-יִהְיֶה הַגּוֹי, אֲשֶׁר לֹא-יָבוֹא שָׁם נִדְּחֵי עולם (עֵילָם).
36.english: And I will bring against Elam the four winds from the four quarters of heaven, and will scatter them toward all those winds; and there shall be no nation whither the dispersed of Elam shall not come.

37.hebrew: וְהַחְתַּתִּי אֶת-עֵילָם לִפְנֵי אֹיְבֵיהֶם וְלִפְנֵי מְבַקְשֵׁי נַפְשָׁם, וְהֵבֵאתִי עֲלֵיהֶם רָעָה אֶת-חֲרוֹן אַפִּי--נְאֻם-יְהוָה; וְשִׁלַּחְתִּי אַחֲרֵיהֶם אֶת-הַחֶרֶב, עַד כַּלּוֹתִי אוֹתָם.
37.english: And I will cause Elam to be dismayed before their enemies, and before them that seek their life; and I will bring evil upon them, even My fierce anger, saith the LORD; and I will send the sword after them, till I have consumed them;

38.hebrew: וְשַׂמְתִּי כִסְאִי, בְּעֵילָם; וְהַאֲבַדְתִּי מִשָּׁם מֶלֶךְ וְשָׂרִים, נְאֻם-יְהוָה.
38.english: And I will set My throne in Elam, and will destroy from thence king and princes, saith the LORD.

39.hebrew: וְהָיָה בְּאַחֲרִית הַיָּמִים, אשוב (אָשִׁיב) אֶת-שבית (שְׁבוּת) עֵילָם--נְאֻם-יְהוָה.  {פ}
39.english: But it shall come to pass in the end of days, that I will bring back the captivity of Elam, saith the LORD. {P}

62.hebrew: ††еја»о«шјъћ», йјде»д а«ъћ»д гƒбћ«шјъћ» а∆м-д«оћ»че…н д«жћ∆д мјд«лјшƒйъе…, мјбƒмјъћƒй дЅйе…ъ-бће… йе…щ—≈б, мјо≈а»г»н ејт«г-бћјд≈о»д:† лћƒй-щ—ƒојое…ъ те…м»н, ъћƒдјй∆д.
62.english: and say: O LORD, Thou hast spoken concerning this place, to cut it off, that none shall dwell therein, neither man nor beast, but that it shall be desolate for ever.

63.english: And it shall be, when thou hast made an end of reading this book, that thou shalt bind a stone to it, and cast it into the midst of the Euphrates;

64.english: and thou shalt say: Thus shall Babylon sink, and shall not rise again because of the evil that I will bring upon her; and they shall be weary.' Thus far are the words of Jeremiah. {P}

1.hebrew: בֶּן-עֶשְׂרִים וְאַחַת שָׁנָה, צִדְקִיָּהוּ בְמָלְכוֹ, וְאַחַת עֶשְׂרֵה שָׁנָה, מָלַךְ בִּירוּשָׁלִָם; וְשֵׁם אִמּוֹ, חמיטל (חֲמוּטַל) בַּת-יִרְמְיָהוּ מִלִּבְנָה.
1.english: Zedekiah was one and twenty years old when he began to reign; and he reigned eleven years in Jerusalem; and his mother's name was Hamutal the daughter of Jeremiah of Libnah.

2.hebrew: וַיַּעַשׂ הָרַע, בְּעֵינֵי יְהוָה, כְּכֹל אֲשֶׁר-עָשָׂה, יְהוֹיָקִם.
2.english: And he did that which was evil in the sight of the LORD, according to all that Jehoiakim had done.

3.hebrew: כִּי עַל-אַף יְהוָה, הָיְתָה בִּירוּשָׁלִַם וִיהוּדָה, עַד-הִשְׁלִיכוֹ אוֹתָם, מֵעַל פָּנָיו; וַיִּמְרֹד צִדְקִיָּהוּ, בְּמֶלֶךְ בָּבֶל.
3.english: For through the anger of the LORD did it come to pass in Jerusalem and Judah, until He had cast them out from His presence. And Zedekiah rebelled against the king of Babylon.

4.hebrew: וַיְהִי בַשָּׁנָה הַתְּשִׁעִית לְמָלְכוֹ, בַּחֹדֶשׁ הָעֲשִׂירִי בֶּעָשׂוֹר לַחֹדֶשׁ, בָּא נְבוּכַדְרֶאצַּר מֶלֶךְ-בָּבֶל הוּא וְכָל-חֵילוֹ עַל-יְרוּשָׁלִַם, וַיַּחֲנוּ עָלֶיהָ; וַיִּבְנוּ עָלֶיהָ דָּיֵק, סָבִיב.
4.english: And it came to pass in the ninth year of his reign, in the tenth month, in the tenth day of the month, that Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon came, he and all his army, against Jerusalem, and encamped against it; and they built forts against it round about.

5.hebrew: וַתָּבֹא הָעִיר, בַּמָּצוֹר, עַד עַשְׁתֵּי עֶשְׂרֵה שָׁנָה, לַמֶּלֶךְ צִדְקִיָּהוּ.
5.english: So the city was besieged unto the eleventh year of king Zedekiah.

6.hebrew: בַּחֹדֶשׁ הָרְבִיעִי בְּתִשְׁעָה לַחֹדֶשׁ, וַיֶּחֱזַק הָרָעָב בָּעִיר; וְלֹא-הָיָה לֶחֶם, לְעַם הָאָרֶץ.
6.english: In the fourth month, in the ninth day of the month, the famine was sore in the city, so that there was no bread for the people of the land.

7.hebrew: וַתִּבָּקַע הָעִיר, וְכָל-אַנְשֵׁי הַמִּלְחָמָה יִבְרְחוּ וַיֵּצְאוּ מֵהָעִיר לַיְלָה דֶּרֶךְ שַׁעַר בֵּין-הַחֹמֹתַיִם אֲשֶׁר עַל-גַּן הַמֶּלֶךְ, וְכַשְׂדִּים עַל-הָעִיר, סָבִיב; וַיֵּלְכוּ, דֶּרֶךְ הָעֲרָבָה.
7.english: Then a breach was made in the city, and all the men of war fled, and went forth out of the city by night by the way of the gate between the two walls, which was by the king's garden--now the Chaldeans were against the city round about--and they went by the way of the Arabah.

8.hebrew: וַיִּרְדְּפוּ חֵיל-כַּשְׂדִּים אַחֲרֵי הַמֶּלֶךְ, וַיַּשִּׂיגוּ אֶת-צִדְקִיָּהוּ בְּעַרְבֹת יְרֵחוֹ; וְכָל-חֵילוֹ--נָפֹצוּ, מֵעָלָיו.
8.english: But the army of the Chaldeans pursued after the king, and overtook Zedekiah in the plains of Jericho; and all his army was scattered from him.

9.hebrew: וַיִּתְפְּשׂוּ, אֶת-הַמֶּלֶךְ, וַיַּעֲלוּ אֹתוֹ אֶל-מֶלֶךְ בָּבֶל רִבְלָתָה, בְּאֶרֶץ חֲמָת; וַיְדַבֵּר אִתּוֹ, מִשְׁפָּטִים.
9.english: Then they took the king, and carried him up unto the king of Babylon to Riblah in the land of Hamath; and he gave judgment upon him.

10.hebrew: וַיִּשְׁחַט מֶלֶךְ-בָּבֶל אֶת-בְּנֵי צִדְקִיָּהוּ, לְעֵינָיו; וְגַם אֶת-כָּל-שָׂרֵי יְהוּדָה, שָׁחַט בְּרִבְלָתָה.
10.english: And the king of Babylon slew the sons of Zedekiah before his eyes; he slew also all the princes of Judah in Riblah.

11.hebrew: וְאֶת-עֵינֵי צִדְקִיָּהוּ, עִוֵּר; וַיַּאַסְרֵהוּ בַנְחֻשְׁתַּיִם, וַיְבִאֵהוּ מֶלֶךְ-בָּבֶל בָּבֶלָה, וַיִּתְּנֵהוּ בבית- (בֵית-) הַפְּקֻדֹּת, עַד-יוֹם מוֹתוֹ.
11.english: And he put out the eyes of Zedekiah; and the king of Babylon bound him in fetters, and carried him to Babylon, and put him in prison till the day of his death.

12.hebrew: וּבַחֹדֶשׁ הַחֲמִישִׁי, בֶּעָשׂוֹר לַחֹדֶשׁ, הִיא שְׁנַת תְּשַׁע-עֶשְׂרֵה שָׁנָה, לַמֶּלֶךְ נְבוּכַדְרֶאצַּר מֶלֶךְ-בָּבֶל--בָּא, נְבוּזַרְאֲדָן רַב-טַבָּחִים, עָמַד לִפְנֵי מֶלֶךְ-בָּבֶל, בִּירוּשָׁלִָם.
12.english: Now in the fifth month, in the tenth day of the month, which was the nineteenth year of king Nebuchadrezzar, king of Babylon, came Nebuzaradan the captain of the guard, who stood before the king of Babylon, into Jerusalem;

13.hebrew: וַיִּשְׂרֹף אֶת-בֵּית-יְהוָה, וְאֶת-בֵּית הַמֶּלֶךְ; וְאֵת כָּל-בָּתֵּי יְרוּשָׁלִַם וְאֶת-כָּל-בֵּית הַגָּדוֹל, שָׂרַף בָּאֵשׁ.
13.english: and he burned the house of the LORD, and the king's house; and all the houses of Jerusalem, even every great man's house, burned he with fire.

14.hebrew: וְאֶת-כָּל-חֹמוֹת יְרוּשָׁלִַם, סָבִיב, נָתְצוּ כָּל-חֵיל כַּשְׂדִּים, אֲשֶׁר אֶת-רַב-טַבָּחִים.
14.english: And all the army of the Chaldeans, that were with the captain of the guard, broke down all the walls of Jerusalem round about.

15.hebrew: וּמִדַּלּוֹת הָעָם וְאֶת-יֶתֶר הָעָם הַנִּשְׁאָרִים בָּעִיר, וְאֶת-הַנֹּפְלִים אֲשֶׁר נָפְלוּ אֶל-מֶלֶךְ בָּבֶל, וְאֵת, יֶתֶר הָאָמוֹן--הֶגְלָה, נְבוּזַרְאֲדָן רַב-טַבָּחִים.
15.english: Then Nebuzaradan the captain of the guard carried away captive of the poorest sort of the people, and the residue of the people that remained in the city, and those that fell away, that fell to the king of Babylon, and the residue of the multitude.

16.hebrew: וּמִדַּלּוֹת הָאָרֶץ--הִשְׁאִיר, נְבוּזַרְאֲדָן רַב-טַבָּחִים:  לְכֹרְמִים, וּלְיֹגְבִים.
16.english: But Nebuzaradan the captain of the guard left of the poorest of the land to be vinedressers and husbandmen.

17.hebrew: וְאֶת-עַמּוּדֵי הַנְּחֹשֶׁת אֲשֶׁר לְבֵית-יְהוָה, וְאֶת-הַמְּכֹנוֹת וְאֶת-יָם הַנְּחֹשֶׁת אֲשֶׁר בְּבֵית-יְהוָה--שִׁבְּרוּ כַשְׂדִּים; וַיִּשְׂאוּ אֶת-כָּל-נְחֻשְׁתָּם, בָּבֶלָה.
17.english: And the pillars of brass that were in the house of the LORD, and the bases and the brazen sea that were in the house of the LORD, did the Chaldeans break in pieces, and carried all the brass of them to Babylon.

18.hebrew: וְאֶת-הַסִּרוֹת וְאֶת-הַיָּעִים וְאֶת-הַמְזַמְּרוֹת וְאֶת-הַמִּזְרָקֹת וְאֶת-הַכַּפּוֹת, וְאֵת כָּל-כְּלֵי הַנְּחֹשֶׁת אֲשֶׁר-יְשָׁרְתוּ בָהֶם--לָקָחוּ.
18.english: The pots also, and the shovels, and the snuffers, and the basins, and the pans, and all the vessels of brass wherewith they ministered, took they away.

19.hebrew: וְאֶת-הַסִּפִּים וְאֶת-הַמַּחְתּוֹת וְאֶת-הַמִּזְרָקוֹת וְאֶת-הַסִּירוֹת וְאֶת-הַמְּנֹרוֹת, וְאֶת-הַכַּפּוֹת וְאֶת-הַמְּנַקִּיּוֹת, אֲשֶׁר זָהָב זָהָב, וַאֲשֶׁר-כֶּסֶף כָּסֶף--לָקַח, רַב-טַבָּחִים.
19.english: And the cups, and the fire-pans, and the basins, and the pots, and the candlesticks, and the pans, and the bowls--that which was of gold, in gold, and that which was of silver, in silver--the captain of the guard took away.

20.hebrew: הָעַמּוּדִים שְׁנַיִם, הַיָּם אֶחָד וְהַבָּקָר שְׁנֵים-עָשָׂר נְחֹשֶׁת אֲשֶׁר-תַּחַת הַמְּכֹנוֹת, אֲשֶׁר עָשָׂה הַמֶּלֶךְ שְׁלֹמֹה, לְבֵית יְהוָה--לֹא-הָיָה מִשְׁקָל, לִנְחֻשְׁתָּם כָּל-הַכֵּלִים הָאֵלֶּה.
20.english: The two pillars, the one sea, and the twelve brazen bulls that were under the bases, which king Solomon had made for the house of the LORD--the brass of all these vessels was without weight.

21.hebrew: וְהָעַמּוּדִים, שְׁמֹנֶה עֶשְׂרֵה אַמָּה קומה (קוֹמַת) הָעַמֻּד הָאֶחָד, וְחוּט שְׁתֵּים-עֶשְׂרֵה אַמָּה, יְסֻבֶּנּוּ; וְעָבְיוֹ אַרְבַּע אֶצְבָּעוֹת, נָבוּב.
21.english: And as for the pillars, the height of the one pillar was eighteen cubits; and a line of twelve cubits did compass it; and the thickness thereof was four fingers; it was hollow.

22.hebrew: וְכֹתֶרֶת עָלָיו נְחֹשֶׁת, וְקוֹמַת הַכֹּתֶרֶת הָאַחַת חָמֵשׁ אַמּוֹת, וּשְׂבָכָה וְרִמּוֹנִים עַל-הַכּוֹתֶרֶת סָבִיב, הַכֹּל נְחֹשֶׁת; וְכָאֵלֶּה לַעַמּוּד הַשֵּׁנִי, וְרִמּוֹנִים.
22.english: And a capital of brass was upon it; and the height of the one capital was five cubits, with network and pomegranates upon the capital round about, all of brass; and the second pillar also had like unto these, and pomegranates.

23.hebrew: וַיִּהְיוּ, הָרִמֹּנִים--תִּשְׁעִים וְשִׁשָּׁה, רוּחָה:  כָּל-הָרִמּוֹנִים מֵאָה עַל-הַשְּׂבָכָה, סָבִיב.  {ס}
23.english: And there were ninety and six pomegranates on the outside; all the pomegranates were a hundred upon the network round about. {S}

24.hebrew: וַיִּקַּח רַב-טַבָּחִים, אֶת-שְׂרָיָה כֹּהֵן הָרֹאשׁ, וְאֶת-צְפַנְיָה, כֹּהֵן הַמִּשְׁנֶה--וְאֶת-שְׁלֹשֶׁת, שֹׁמְרֵי הַסַּף.
24.english: And the captain of the guard took Seraiah the chief priest, and Zephaniah the second priest, and the three keepers of the door;

25.hebrew: וּמִן-הָעִיר לָקַח סָרִיס אֶחָד אֲשֶׁר-הָיָה פָקִיד עַל-אַנְשֵׁי הַמִּלְחָמָה, וְשִׁבְעָה אֲנָשִׁים מֵרֹאֵי פְנֵי-הַמֶּלֶךְ אֲשֶׁר נִמְצְאוּ בָעִיר, וְאֵת סֹפֵר שַׂר הַצָּבָא, הַמַּצְבִּא אֶת-עַם הָאָרֶץ; וְשִׁשִּׁים אִישׁ מֵעַם הָאָרֶץ, הַנִּמְצְאִים בְּתוֹךְ הָעִיר.
25.english: and out of the city he took an officer that was set over the men of war; and seven men of them that saw the king's face, who were found in the city; and the scribe of the captain of the host, who mustered the people of the land; and threescore men of the people of the land, that were found in the midst of the city.

26.hebrew: וַיִּקַּח אוֹתָם, נְבוּזַרְאֲדָן רַב-טַבָּחִים; וַיֹּלֶךְ אוֹתָם אֶל-מֶלֶךְ בָּבֶל, רִבְלָתָה.
26.english: And Nebuzaradan the captain of the guard took them, and brought them to the king of Babylon to Riblah.

27.hebrew: וַיַּכֶּה אוֹתָם מֶלֶךְ בָּבֶל וַיְמִתֵם בְּרִבְלָה, בְּאֶרֶץ חֲמָת; וַיִּגֶל יְהוּדָה, מֵעַל אַדְמָתוֹ.  {ס}
27.english: And the king of Babylon smote them, and put them to death at Riblah in the land of Hamath. So Judah was carried away captive out of his land. {S}

28.hebrew: זֶה הָעָם, אֲשֶׁר הֶגְלָה נְבוּכַדְרֶאצַּר:  בִּשְׁנַת-שֶׁבַע--יְהוּדִים, שְׁלֹשֶׁת אֲלָפִים וְעֶשְׂרִים וּשְׁלֹשָׁה.
28.english: This is the people whom Nebuchadrezzar carried away captive: in the seventh year three thousand Jews and three and twenty;

29.hebrew: בִּשְׁנַת שְׁמוֹנֶה עֶשְׂרֵה, לִנְבוּכַדְרֶאצַּר:  מִירוּשָׁלִַם--נֶפֶשׁ, שְׁמֹנֶה מֵאוֹת שְׁלֹשִׁים וּשְׁנָיִם.
29.english: in the eighteenth year of Nebuchadrezzar, from Jerusalem, eight hundred thirty and two persons;

30.hebrew: בִּשְׁנַת שָׁלֹשׁ וְעֶשְׂרִים, לִנְבוּכַדְרֶאצַּר, הֶגְלָה נְבוּזַרְאֲדָן רַב-טַבָּחִים, יְהוּדִים נֶפֶשׁ שְׁבַע מֵאוֹת אַרְבָּעִים וַחֲמִשָּׁה; כָּל-נֶפֶשׁ, אַרְבַּעַת אֲלָפִים וְשֵׁשׁ מֵאוֹת.  {ס}
30.english: in the three and twentieth year of Nebuchadrezzar Nebuzaradan the captain of the guard carried away captive of the Jews seven hundred forty and five persons; all the persons were four thousand and six hundred. {S}

31.hebrew: וַיְהִי בִשְׁלֹשִׁים וָשֶׁבַע שָׁנָה, לְגָלוּת יְהוֹיָכִן מֶלֶךְ-יְהוּדָה, בִּשְׁנֵים עָשָׂר חֹדֶשׁ, בְּעֶשְׂרִים וַחֲמִשָּׁה לַחֹדֶשׁ:  נָשָׂא אֱוִיל מְרֹדַךְ מֶלֶךְ בָּבֶל בִּשְׁנַת מַלְכֻתוֹ, אֶת-רֹאשׁ יְהוֹיָכִין מֶלֶךְ-יְהוּדָה, וַיֹּצֵא אֹתוֹ, מִבֵּית הכליא (הַכְּלוּא).
31.english: And it came to pass in the seven and thirtieth year of the captivity of Jehoiachin king of Judah, in the twelfth month, in the five and twentieth day of the month, that Evil-merodach king of Babylon, in the first year of his reign, lifted up the head of Jehoiachin king of Judah, and brought him forth out of prison.

32.hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּר אִתּוֹ, טֹבוֹת; וַיִּתֵּן, אֶת-כִּסְאוֹ, מִמַּעַל לְכִסֵּא מלכים (הַמְּלָכִים) אֲשֶׁר אִתּוֹ, בְּבָבֶל.
32.english: And he spoke kindly to him, and set his throne above the throne of the kings that were with him in Babylon.

33.hebrew: וְשִׁנָּה, אֵת בִּגְדֵי כִלְאוֹ; וְאָכַל לֶחֶם לְפָנָיו תָּמִיד, כָּל-יְמֵי חַיָּו.
33.english: And he changed his prison garments, and did eat bread before him continually all the days of his life.

34.hebrew: וַאֲרֻחָתוֹ, אֲרֻחַת תָּמִיד נִתְּנָה-לּוֹ מֵאֵת מֶלֶךְ-בָּבֶל דְּבַר-יוֹם בְּיוֹמוֹ--עַד-יוֹם מוֹתוֹ:  כֹּל, יְמֵי חַיָּיו.  {ש}
34.english: And for his allowance, there was a continual allowance given him of the king of Babylon, every day a portion until the day of his death, all the days of his life. {P}

1.hebrew: דִּבְרֵי יִרְמְיָהוּ, בֶּן-חִלְקִיָּהוּ, מִן-הַכֹּהֲנִים אֲשֶׁר בַּעֲנָתוֹת, בְּאֶרֶץ בִּנְיָמִן.
1.english: The words of Jeremiah the son of Hilkiah, of the priests that were in Anathoth in the land of Benjamin,

2.hebrew: אֲשֶׁר הָיָה דְבַר-יְהוָה אֵלָיו, בִּימֵי יֹאשִׁיָּהוּ בֶן-אָמוֹן מֶלֶךְ יְהוּדָה, בִּשְׁלֹשׁ-עֶשְׂרֵה שָׁנָה, לְמָלְכוֹ.
2.english: to whom the word of the LORD came in the days of Josiah the son of Amon, king of Judah, in the thirteenth year of his reign.

3.hebrew: וַיְהִי, בִּימֵי יְהוֹיָקִים בֶּן-יֹאשִׁיָּהוּ מֶלֶךְ יְהוּדָה, עַד-תֹּם עַשְׁתֵּי עֶשְׂרֵה שָׁנָה, לְצִדְקִיָּהוּ בֶן-יֹאשִׁיָּהוּ מֶלֶךְ יְהוּדָה--עַד-גְּלוֹת יְרוּשָׁלִַם, בַּחֹדֶשׁ הַחֲמִישִׁי.  {פ}
3.english: It came also in the days of Jehoiakim the son of Josiah, king of Judah, unto the end of the eleventh year of Zedekiah the son of Josiah, king of Judah, unto the carrying away of Jerusalem captive in the fifth month. {P}

4.hebrew: וַיְהִי דְבַר-יְהוָה, אֵלַי לֵאמֹר.
4.english: And the word of the LORD came unto me, saying:

5.hebrew: בְּטֶרֶם אצורך (אֶצָּרְךָ) בַבֶּטֶן יְדַעְתִּיךָ, וּבְטֶרֶם תֵּצֵא מֵרֶחֶם הִקְדַּשְׁתִּיךָ:  נָבִיא לַגּוֹיִם, נְתַתִּיךָ.
5.english: Before I formed thee in the belly I knew thee, and before thou camest forth out of the womb I sanctified thee; I have appointed thee a prophet unto the nations.

6.hebrew: וָאֹמַר, אֲהָהּ אֲדֹנָי יְהוִה, הִנֵּה לֹא-יָדַעְתִּי, דַּבֵּר:  כִּי-נַעַר, אָנֹכִי.  {ס}
6.english: Then said I: 'Ah, Lord GOD! behold, I cannot speak; for I am a child.' {S}

7.hebrew: וַיֹּאמֶר יְהוָה אֵלַי, אַל-תֹּאמַר נַעַר אָנֹכִי:  כִּי עַל-כָּל-אֲשֶׁר אֶשְׁלָחֲךָ, תֵּלֵךְ, וְאֵת כָּל-אֲשֶׁר אֲצַוְּךָ, תְּדַבֵּר.
7.english: But the LORD said unto me: say not: I am a child; for to whomsoever I shall send thee thou shalt go, and whatsoever I shall command thee thou shalt speak.

8.hebrew: אַל-תִּירָא, מִפְּנֵיהֶם:  כִּי-אִתְּךָ אֲנִי לְהַצִּלֶךָ, נְאֻם-יְהוָה.
8.english: Be not afraid of them; for I am with thee to deliver thee, saith the LORD.

9.hebrew: וַיִּשְׁלַח יְהוָה אֶת-יָדוֹ, וַיַּגַּע עַל-פִּי; וַיֹּאמֶר יְהוָה אֵלַי, הִנֵּה נָתַתִּי דְבָרַי בְּפִיךָ.
9.english: Then the LORD put forth His hand, and touched my mouth; and the LORD said unto me: Behold, I have put My words in thy mouth;

10.hebrew: רְאֵה הִפְקַדְתִּיךָ הַיּוֹם הַזֶּה, עַל-הַגּוֹיִם וְעַל-הַמַּמְלָכוֹת, לִנְתוֹשׁ וְלִנְתוֹץ, וּלְהַאֲבִיד וְלַהֲרוֹס--לִבְנוֹת, וְלִנְטוֹעַ.  {פ}
10.english: See, I have this day set thee over the nations and over the kingdoms, to root out and to pull down, and to destroy and to overthrow; to build, and to plant. {P}

11.hebrew: וַיְהִי דְבַר-יְהוָה אֵלַי לֵאמֹר, מָה-אַתָּה רֹאֶה יִרְמְיָהוּ; וָאֹמַר, מַקֵּל שָׁקֵד אֲנִי רֹאֶה.
11.english: Moreover the word of the LORD came unto me, saying: 'Jeremiah, what seest thou?' And I said: 'I see a rod of an almond-tree.'

12.hebrew: וַיֹּאמֶר יְהוָה אֵלַי, הֵיטַבְתָּ לִרְאוֹת:  כִּי-שֹׁקֵד אֲנִי עַל-דְּבָרִי, לַעֲשֹׂתוֹ.  {ס}
12.english: Then said the LORD unto me: 'Thou hast well seen; for I watch over My word to perform it.' {S}

13.hebrew: וַיְהִי דְבַר-יְהוָה אֵלַי שֵׁנִית לֵאמֹר, מָה אַתָּה רֹאֶה; וָאֹמַר, סִיר נָפוּחַ אֲנִי רֹאֶה, וּפָנָיו, מִפְּנֵי צָפוֹנָה.
13.english: And the word of the LORD came unto me the second time, saying: 'What seest thou?' And I said: 'I see a seething pot; and the face thereof is from the north.'

14.hebrew: וַיֹּאמֶר יְהוָה, אֵלָי:  מִצָּפוֹן תִּפָּתַח הָרָעָה, עַל כָּל-יֹשְׁבֵי הָאָרֶץ.
14.english: Then the LORD said unto me: 'Out of the north the evil shall break forth upon all the inhabitants of the land.

15.hebrew: כִּי הִנְנִי קֹרֵא, לְכָל-מִשְׁפְּחוֹת מַמְלְכוֹת צָפוֹנָה--נְאֻם-יְהוָה; וּבָאוּ וְנָתְנוּ אִישׁ כִּסְאוֹ פֶּתַח שַׁעֲרֵי יְרוּשָׁלִַם, וְעַל כָּל-חוֹמֹתֶיהָ סָבִיב, וְעַל, כָּל-עָרֵי יְהוּדָה.
15.english: For, lo, I will call all the families of the kingdoms of the north, saith the LORD; and they shall come, and they shall set every one his throne at the entrance of the gates of Jerusalem, and against all the walls thereof round about, and against all the cities of Judah.

16.hebrew: וְדִבַּרְתִּי מִשְׁפָּטַי אוֹתָם, עַל כָּל-רָעָתָם--אֲשֶׁר עֲזָבוּנִי, וַיְקַטְּרוּ לֵאלֹהִים אֲחֵרִים, וַיִּשְׁתַּחֲווּ, לְמַעֲשֵׂי יְדֵיהֶם.
16.english: And I will utter My judgments against them touching all their wickedness; in that they have forsaken me, and have offered unto other gods, and worshipped the work of their own hands.

17.hebrew: וְאַתָּה, תֶּאְזֹר מָתְנֶיךָ, וְקַמְתָּ וְדִבַּרְתָּ אֲלֵיהֶם, אֵת כָּל-אֲשֶׁר אָנֹכִי אֲצַוֶּךָּ; אַל-תֵּחַת, מִפְּנֵיהֶם--פֶּן-אֲחִתְּךָ, לִפְנֵיהֶם.
17.english: Thou therefore gird up thy loins, and arise, and speak unto them all that I command thee; be not dismayed at them, lest I dismay thee before them.

18.hebrew: וַאֲנִי הִנֵּה נְתַתִּיךָ הַיּוֹם, לְעִיר מִבְצָר וּלְעַמּוּד בַּרְזֶל וּלְחֹמוֹת נְחֹשֶׁת--עַל-כָּל-הָאָרֶץ:  לְמַלְכֵי יְהוּדָה לְשָׂרֶיהָ, לְכֹהֲנֶיהָ וּלְעַם הָאָרֶץ.
18.english: For, behold, I have made thee this day a fortified city, and an iron pillar, and brazen walls, against the whole land, against the kings of Judah, against the princes thereof, against the priests thereof, and against the people of the land.

19.hebrew: וְנִלְחֲמוּ אֵלֶיךָ, וְלֹא-יוּכְלוּ לָךְ:  כִּי-אִתְּךָ אֲנִי נְאֻם-יְהוָה, לְהַצִּילֶךָ.  {פ}
19.english: And they shall fight against thee; but they shall not prevail against thee; For I am with thee, saith the LORD, to deliver thee.' {P}
